jobsdetail.description: Description Lead Blockchain Payments Engineer - Fiat Ramps Location: Full‑time, in‑person — London We are Baton Corporation, a team of elite builders moving fast and redefining what's possible in the fintech and crypto space. As a high-growth software company, we are proud contributors to pump.fun, the largest crypto social network globally. We build for the future, driven by a philosophy of speed, ownership, and talent density. As the Lead Blockchain Payments Engineer, you will be a core architect and owner of the essential financial infrastructure. You will design and scale the core services that power seamless fiat ↔ crypto flows, real-time risk decisions, and rock-solid financial records. Key Responsibilities Payment Orchestration & Integrations: Own the end-to-end payment orchestration for major bank rails (ACH/RTP/FedNow/SEPA/Open Banking) and cards (including Apple Pay/Google Pay). Design and implement idempotent, fault-tolerant APIs and robust webhook processing systems. Integrate and manage third-party providers for connectivity (Plaid/TrueLayer/Tink), card processing (Stripe/Checkout.com/Adyen), and on-chain risk/compliance (Chainalysis/TRM, Travel Rule networks). Real-Time Risk & Compliance: Build and scale a real-time risk engine ($\le 300$ms) combining ML scores, rules, device signals, sanctions/KYC hits, payment intelligence, and blockchain analytics to yield fast GREEN/AMBER/RED outcomes. Implement foundational KYC/AML primitives (CIP/CDD, sanctions/PEP screening, Travel Rule data plumbing) in close partnership with our Compliance team, ensuring audit-ready decision journaling. Financial Integrity & Reconciliation: Ship a double-entry ledger and automated reconciliation jobs that accurately tie together processors, bank statements, and on-chain balances. Develop daily break detection and automated remediation workflows to maintain financial integrity. Blockchain & Wallet Operations: Ensure safe and rapid crypto delivery (e.g., USDC/SOL) to user wallets by managing hot-wallet flows, transaction creation, confirmations, and operational safeguards. Reliability & Instrumentation: Set the bar for reliability: implement SLOs, circuit breakers, retries/backoffs, dead-letter queues, shadow traffic, and canary releases for all high-risk financial flows. Instrument everything with traces, metrics, and logs. Build internal ops & compliance dashboards and participate in the production on-call rotation for our 24/7 system. title: Head of Product- dev.fun
location: Sliding scale - PST preference, US Remote, Asia, Europe

jobsdetail.description:
Overview
dev.fun is building the next generation of consumer crypto + AI products, giving anyone the power to spin up on-chain apps, launch their own token, and raise capital in minutes. Weʼre now hiring a senior, crypto-native Head of Product who can own product end-to-end.

This role requires someone who has already owned an entire product surface at a founder or near-founder level, ideally at a real DeFi, launchpad, or DEX product. You will partner directly with the founding team, drive product strategy across our crypto surfaces, and elevate the quality bar, taste, and execution speed across the entire org.

What Youʼll Do
Own the full product strategy and execution across dev.funʼs crypto ecosystem, from discovery → build → launch → iteration.

Act as a strategic partner to founders, translating vision, market dynamics and user needs into clear product direction.

Lead the crypto product surface (launchpad, token mechanics, wallets,
financial flows, incentives, on-chain UX with true end-to-end accountability.

Direct, mentor, and up-level PMs, including leading and developing our
existing Product Manager.

Set the product roadmap, define priorities, run product rituals, and create systems that keep the org aligned and shipping fast.

Partner cross-functionally with engineering, design, data, and growth to deliver high-quality features at high velocity.

Elevate UX and product taste across the full user surface, ensuring cohesive, intuitive, and high-quality consumer crypto experiences.

Stay deeply tapped into consumer crypto, DeFi, and “trench culture,ˮ using
market intuition to shape product bets.

Build clear metrics frameworks, run experiments, and drive continual improvement across activation, retention, and monetization.
jobsdetail.requirement:
What Weʼre Looking For
1) Founder-Level Product Ownership
- Someone who has owned an entire product surface before at founder or
near-founder level.
- Has taken a crypto or financial product from concept → launch → scale.
- Able to make strategic decisions, manage ambiguity, and operate with full accountability.

2) Deep Crypto Product Experience
- Experience at a real DeFi protocol, launchpad, DEX, or high-velocity consumer crypto product.
- Strong understanding of on-chain UX, token incentives, user behavior, and market dynamics.
- Crypto-native operator who uses the products we build for.

3) Strong Taste & UX Leadership
- Exceptional UX and product taste.
- Able to raise the quality bar and bring cohesion across the entire product surface.
- Understands how to build addictively smooth, intuitive crypto consumer experiences.


4) Product Org Builder
- Has managed PMs, built product rituals, and run execution across multiple surfaces.

- Comfortable building processes that keep a remote, async team aligned without slowing them down.
- Can scale the product organization as we grow.

5) Remote-First Operator
- Experienced working async across multiple time zones.
- Clear, high-signal communicator who excels in written documentation.
- Thrives in fast-paced, high-ambiguity startup environments.


Ideal Background
- Founder or early PM at a crypto company, launchpad, exchange, DEX, or
consumer DeFi protocol.
- Someone with a proven track record of shipping, scaling, and owning complex crypto products.
- A “builder-operator,ˮ hungry, scrappy, with high agency and strong execution.
- Years of experience matter less than proof youʼve truly done this before.
jobsdetail.benefits:

What We Offer
Remote-first culture with flexible async collaboration.
Competitive base salary in USDC + token allocation.
Direct ownership of dev.funʼs crypto product surfaces.
Small, senior team that ships quickly and cares deeply about product quality.

Strong understanding of on-chain UX, token incentives, user behavior, market dynamics and knows how to build addictively smooth, intuitive crypto consumer experiences

title: Software Engineer: Gauntlet App
location: USA, Canada and would consider candidates based in Puerto Rico

jobsdetail.description:
Description
Gauntlet leads the field in quantitative research and optimization of DeFi economics. We manage market risk, optimize growth, and ensure economic safety for protocols facilitating most spot trading, borrowing, and lending activity across all of DeFi, protecting and optimizing the largest protocols and networks in the industry. As of April 2025, Gauntlet manages risk and incentives covering over $42 billion in customer TVL.

Gauntlet continually publishes cutting-edge research that informs our risk models, alerts, and analysis, and is among the most cited institution — including academic institutions — in terms of peer-reviewed papers addressing DeFi as a subject. We’re a Series B company with around 75 employees, operating remote-first with a home base in New York City.

Gauntlet’s mission is to drive adoption and understanding in the financial systems of the future. Building with decentralized systems creates novel challenges for mechanism designers, smart contract developers, and end-users of financial products, which are not seen in traditional software development and investing contexts. Gauntlet is dedicated to enhancing our industry’s understanding of this new domain and revealing how to safely navigate the true bleeding edge of 21st-century financial innovation.

Gauntlet App:

Join a newly formed product pod focused on the Gauntlet App — our next-generation dApp that allows users to deposit and withdraw into vaults directly. This role is part of a critical initiative to evolve our dashboard into a product directly connected to revenue. You'll be working on a high-impact project tightly aligned with Gauntlet’s core strategy, helping build a robust, user-facing experience at the heart of our business.

Responsibilities

Lead the design, development, and maintenance of full-stack features for Gauntlet’s decentralized application, ensuring high performance and scalability

Partner closely with front-end engineers to deliver cohesive and well-integrated user experiences

Provide technical leadership and mentorship to other engineers, fostering collaboration and knowledge sharing

Engage in systems design and architecture discussions to build robust backend services supporting the application

Participate actively in code reviews and design sessions, promoting best practices and high-quality code standards

Collaborate with product managers and researchers to translate requirements into effective technical solutions

Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex software issues to maintain system reliability and performance
jobsdetail.requirement:
Qualifications

5+ years of professional experience in software development, with a focus on full-stack engineering.

Strong proficiency in TypeScript for full-stack development

Proven ability to design and implement user-centric applications, emphasizing seamless user experiences.

Solid experience with backend systems and APIs, including systems design and architecture

Familiarity with Python or the ability to be language agnostic

Proven ability to collaborate effectively with others engineers and mentor team members

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with a focus on application development lifecycle

Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a distributed team environment

Bonus Points

Interest or experience in DeFi concepts like decentralized applications (dApps) and on-chain interactions

Familiarity with financial technology (fintech) products and user experiences.

Previous work on applications that handle monetary transactions or sensitive user data.

Familiarity with application development lifecycle from end to end

Experience developing and shipping user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks such as React

History utilizing, at any level, technologies and languages like Solidity or Rust

Experience working in smaller teams or startups, demonstrating broad technical versatility

Background working with data pipelines or tooling, including ETL processes, orchestration tools and integrating data flows in production environments
jobsdetail.benefits:
Compensation & Package
We provide base salary, On Target Earning potential in terms of cash bonuses & equity refreshers, in addition to your initial equity grant based on our Series B eval

Benefits and Perks

Remote first - work from anywhere in the US & CAN!

Competitive packages with the added opportunity for incentive-based compensation

Regular in-person company retreats and cross-country "office visit" perk

100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for employees

Laptop provided

$1,000 WFH stipend upon joining

$100 per month reimbursement for fitness-related expenses

Monthly reimbursement for home internet, phone, and cellular data

Unlimited vacation policy

100% paid parental leave of 12 weeks

Fertility benefits

Interview Process
1
Recruiter / HR Call

Please advise the candidate to research Gauntlet prior to their meeting (their research, blog posts, comms in the forums for projects, their positions, their products, their vaults etc). They have publicly available info on the company and what they have done in the space. They're looking for candidates who are fully prepared.

2
Hiring Manager Interview

3
Technical Interview

Can use any backend language (preference for Python!)

4
Group Interview

4-5 hour group interview preferably split over two days if needed

Hiring Criteria

5+ years of professional experience in software development, with a focus on full-stack engineering.

Strong proficiency in TypeScript for full-stack development

Experience building financial data

Experience building a product end to end

Familiarity with Python or the ability to be language agnostic & Solid experience with backend systems and APIs, including systems design and architecture.

Recruiting Tips
Ideal Candidate profile
Someone who has built a product end to end

Someone who has built financial data

Solid Fullstack experience or a profile that has transitioned from FE to BE (one of the interview rounds is front end focused)

Data Pipelining Experience

IMPORTANT!

Gauntlet are keen to be introduced to candidates they've never spoken to before. When screening candidates please ensure you're double checking if they've ever applied or interviewed before. Thanks!

Other Key Info:

Crypto/Web3 experience is a nice to have not essential

Rust is a nice to have


About Gauntlet
Institutional-grade vaults for decentralized finance

Our vaults provide risk-adjusted DeFi yields for institutional capital at scale. These strategies are optimized by our automated risk platform— designed by the most vigilant, quantitative minds in crypto.

We monitor market conditions to execute on growth opportunities and preserve self-custodial capital by minimizing downside exposure.

Our Applied Research team translates novel DeFi research into actionable protocol optimizations, risk mitigation techniques, and growth strategies.

Through rigorous data analysis, simulation modeling, and economic design principles, we help projects—from early-stage networks to established ecosystems—launch and scale with confidence.

By combining our deep expertise in cryptoeconomics, mechanism design, and traditional finance, we deliver sustainable, data-driven recommendations and systems that reduce systemic risk, enhance protocol stability, and accelerate growth.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Kotlin - Fintech)- Deblock
location: Fully remote across Europe - they can do B2B or hire through EoR.

jobsdetail.description:
Important: Please read the following before referring candidates
The ideal candidate will have solid Kotlin experience and strong FinTech experience, ideally working within payments and SEPA.
They like to hire from reputable Web3 and FinTech companies.
Sweet spot for this role in terms of budget is $115k but will go up to $140k for top candidates.
This is an urgent hire.

Description
🔥 THIS IS A SENIOR/LEAD POSITION

🤑 Experience in FinTech and or crypto required

As a Backend Engineer, you’ll be directly working with the product team. In this fast-paced environment, you’ll be given complex banking and crypto problems to solve, develop and deploy. You are obsessed with our good architecture, efficiency, and resilience and want nothing but the best product for our customers.
Your speed, ability to deliver, and capacity to come up with the most elegant solutions will make you one of the pillars of our engineering team.
We want to revolutionise the FinTech and crypto industry. Create a new paradigm. And we need the best minds to do it 🧠 🚀

👀 What we are looking for

Experience with Kotlin
Enjoy working with the modern backend stack (Kafka, PostgreSQL, Redis, GCP)
Experience in FinTech/Crypto
Ability to develop, test and deploy microservices to support our core business
Ability to develop, debug, test, and deploy APIs
Team players: Credit the team & Blame no one
jobsdetail.requirement:
🤩 What will make you stand out
4+ years of experience as a Backend Engineer
Experience working specifically with SEPA and/or payments
🧑‍💻 What you’ll be working on
Develop the core banking and blockchain services
Develop the mobile API that feeds our mobile apps and web
Integrate with partners and services

What you’ll get
Competitive salary + stock options
Private dental + health insurance
The best tech for your job
30 days of paid holidays (excl. bank holidays)
Option to work 100% remotely or come to the office - your choice!
Ability to work abroad for 4 months a year

Interview Process
1.Hiring Manager Interview
Deblock are proposing to skip this stage and to move straight to home task to make the process more efficient. If the candidate would like an intro call it can be arranged.
2. Take Home Test
3.Technical Interview
4. Behavioural Interview

Hiring Criteria
Experience with Kotlin
Enjoy working with the modern backend stack (Kafka, PostgreSQL, Redis, GCP)
Experience in FinTech (in particular working with SEPA and Payments)
Ability to develop, test and deploy microservices to support our core business
jobsdetail.benefits:
Recruiting Tips
The ideal candidate will have solid Kotlin experience and strong FinTech experience, ideally working within payments and SEPA.
They like to hire from reputable Web3 and FinTech companies.
Sweet spot for this role in terms of budget is $115k but will go up to $140k for top candidates.
This is an urgent hire.

About Deblock
Deblock is a London-based fintech company founded in 2022 that's building a financial platform to bridge the gap between traditional banking and decentralized finance. Their core mission is to give users complete ownership and control of their money and digital assets through a secure, self-custodial approach. Unlike many traditional fintech or crypto apps, DeBlock is regulated by the ACPR (Banque de France) and the AMF (Financial Markets Authority), providing a high level of credibility and security.

What They Do
Deblock offers an integrated financial platform that combines the best of both traditional and decentralized finance. The service provides users with:
Non-Custodial Crypto Wallet: A multi-currency wallet that gives users full control over their private keys and digital assets.
Integrated Banking Services: Each account includes a European IBAN, a physical or virtual debit card, and instant SEPA transfers.
Seamless Crypto-to-Fiat Exchange: Users can easily convert cryptocurrencies to fiat and vice-versa directly within the app, which is a key differentiator from many traditional crypto exchanges.
Yield on Digital Assets: The platform provides opportunities to earn a competitive yield (up to 10%) on assets held in vaults.
Business Accounts: For businesses, DeBlock offers accounts with multi-signature wallets to enhance security and control over corporate funds.

The Team
The company was founded by a leadership team with deep experience in both traditional fintech and crypto:
Jean Meyer, CEO and Co-Founder (ex-Revolut Crypto Chief)
Aaron Beck, Co-Founder (ex-Revolut Payment Chief)
Mario Eguiliuz, Co-Founder (ex-Ledger Engineering Chief)
Adriana Restrepo, COO (Ex Revolut COO)
The team's background at major players like Revolut and Ledger highlights their expertise in building scalable, secure, and user-friendly financial products.

Funding
Deblock has successfully raised a total of $26.1 million in seed funding across several rounds. A significant portion of this funding, a $14.3 million round in November 2024, was led by prominent venture capital firms including Headline, Hoxton Ventures, and 20VC. This funding demonstrates strong investor confidence in Deblock's business model and vision.

Company Culture and Work Environment
Deblock is a dynamic and globally diverse company with over 60 employees from 12 different countries. They've built a culture that values flexibility and talent, offering a number of benefits:
Remote-First: The company operates on a 100% remote basis.
Flexibility: Employees have the option to work abroad for up to four months per year.
Generous Leave: The company provides 30 days of annual leave.
Competitive Compensation: Compensation is structured to be in the top 1% for the European market.
Additional Benefits: Private health insurance is provided for all employees.
https://deblock.com/en-FR

title: Data Scientist- Gauntlet
location: US, Canada and would consider candidates based in Puerto Rico

jobsdetail.description:
Gauntlet is the industry leader in quantitative research and optimization for DeFi economics. We manage market risk, accelerate protocol growth, and ensure economic safety for platforms that facilitate the majority of spot trading, borrowing, and lending activity across the entire DeFi ecosystem. Our work protects and optimizes the largest protocols and blockchain networks in the industry.

We also build institutional-grade DeFi vaults that deliver scalable, risk-adjusted on-chain yields — designed by some of the most rigorous quantitative minds in crypto and backed by years of research. As of April 2025, Gauntlet oversees risk and incentive programs supporting more than $42 billion in customer TVL.

Gauntlet publishes cutting-edge research that powers our risk models, alerts, and analyses, and we are among the most cited organizations — including academic institutions — in peer-reviewed DeFi research. We are a Series B company with roughly 75 employees, operating remote-first with a home base in New York City.

To expand our impact in the DeFi space, we are seeking experienced Data Scientists to help both new and established protocols better understand and optimize the systems they’ve built. This role requires strong analytical and interpretive capabilities, as well as the ability to collaborate with and manage external clients. You will work directly with leading, innovative DeFi protocols and develop deep expertise in the mechanisms that power the industry.

Responsibilities

  1. Conduct in-depth, novel research to improve the safety and efficiency of premier DeFi protocols through mechanism design, data analysis, and dynamic parameter optimization.
  2. Take full ownership of client engagements — including scoping work, managing relationships, and delivering impactful research and insights.
  3. Draft and publish high-quality research for public audiences to strengthen Gauntlet’s brand and fulfill client needs.
  4. Build and deploy clear, intuitive, and visually compelling dashboards for both internal and external stakeholders.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Qualifications

  1. 4+ years of professional experience.
  2. Exceptional communication skills with the ability to manage and support external clients effectively.
  3. Demonstrated ability to extract deep, actionable insights from complex datasets.
  4. Crypto-native with strong experience working in the Web3 ecosystem.
  5. Proficiency in data querying languages (e.g., SQL), scripting languages (e.g., Python), and/or statistical or mathematical tools (e.g., R).
  6. Ability to work autonomously and make progress toward abstract or open-ended goals.
  7. Experience with pricing models, financial products, and/or multiple asset classes.

Bonus Points

  1. Experience with derivatives-style products.
  2. Previous experience managing external client relationships.
  3. Published or presented research within the crypto, DeFi, or broader financial space.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Compensation & Package

We offer a competitive compensation package that includes base salary, On-Target Earnings (OTE) through cash bonuses, and equity refreshers in addition to the initial equity grant based on our Series B valuation.

Benefits & Perks

  1. Remote-first — work from anywhere in the US & Canada
  2. Competitive compensation with additional incentive-based earning opportunities
  3. Regular in-person company retreats and cross-country “office visit” perks
  4. 100% paid medical, dental, and vision premiums for employees
  5. Company-provided laptop
  6. $1,000 WFH setup stipend upon joining
  7. $100/month fitness expense reimbursement
  8. Monthly reimbursement for home internet, phone, and cellular data
  9. Unlimited vacation policy
  10. 12 weeks of fully paid parental leave
  11. Fertility support benefits

Interview Process

  1. Recruiter / HR Call
  2. Important: Candidates should thoroughly research Gauntlet before the call — including research publications, blog posts, forum communications, protocol partnerships, vault products, and recent updates. Gauntlet expects candidates to come fully prepared.
  3. Hiring Manager Interview
  4. Technical Interview
  5. Group Interview
  6. A 4–5 hour interview, possibly split across two days

Hiring Criteria

  1. 4+ years of professional experience, ideally including Web3 and FinTech exposure
  2. Exceptional communication and client-management skills
  3. Proven ability to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets
  4. Experience with SQL, Python, and/or statistical or mathematical tools (e.g., R)
  5. Experience with market-making or related financial activities

Recruiting Tips (Important!)

Gauntlet strongly prefers being introduced to candidates they have never engaged with before.

When screening, always verify whether the candidate has previously applied or interviewed with Gauntlet.

About Gauntlet

Institutional-grade vaults for decentralized finance

Gauntlet develops institutional-scale vaults that generate risk-adjusted DeFi yields. These strategies are powered by our automated risk platform, designed by leading quantitative experts in crypto. We continuously monitor market conditions to capture growth opportunities while protecting self-custodial capital and minimizing downside exposure.

Applied Research & Protocol Optimization

Our Applied Research team transforms cutting-edge DeFi research into actionable strategies that improve protocol efficiency, mitigate risk, and support sustainable ecosystem growth. Through rigorous data analysis, simulation modeling, and economic design principles, we help both early-stage networks and established ecosystems scale with confidence.

By combining deep expertise in cryptoeconomics, mechanism design, and traditional finance, Gauntlet delivers data-driven recommendations and systems that reduce systemic risk, enhance protocol stability, and accelerate long-term growth.

Resources

  1. About Gauntlet: https://www.gauntlet.xyz/about
  2. Open Positions: https://www.gauntlet.xyz/careers#open-roles
  3. Gauntlet Research: https://www.gauntlet.xyz/gauntlet-applied-research
  4. Gauntlet Blog: https://www.gauntlet.xyz/resources
  5. Gauntlet Vaults: https://vaultbook.gauntlet.xyz/

title: Core Dev- Seamless Protocol
location: Candidates must be located in an American timezone (this includes North and South America)

jobsdetail.description:
Updated required links - candidates will need a github link


About Seamless

Seamless Protocol aims to simplify DeFi and make advanced yield opportunities accessible to anyone, anywhere. Guided by the vision of creating transparent and reliable DeFi experiences, Seamless transforms complex strategies into intuitive, one-click products for both individuals and institutions.

What We Build

  1. Leverage Tokens – ERC-20 assets that integrate borrowing, swapping, and automated rebalancing, giving users amplified exposure without the burden of managing positions manually.
  2. Seamless Vaults – Curated strategy vaults that automate liquidity deployment and risk management so capital is never idle.
  3. Seamless Staking – Lock SEAM to earn protocol fees.
  4. Seamless Governance – Community-driven decision-making that guides product launches, risk parameters, and treasury growth.
  5. Why Work With Us
  6. Category Ownership – We're defining the next generation of DeFi primitives—packaged leverage—on Base and beyond. Your code will reach hundreds of thousands of wallets and manage nine-figure TVL from day one.
  7. High Impact & Autonomy – Small, senior-heavy squads own problems end-to-end. From ideation to governance proposal to mainnet deployment, your work ships fast.
  8. Open-Source & Community-First – All core smart contracts are public, auditable, and built for composability.
  9. Sustainable Incentives – Revenue flows back to contributors through Seamless Staking, aligning long-term protocol health with SEAM holders.

Our Culture

  1. Clarity Over Complexity – Whether it's UI or Solidity, we prioritize simplicity and user focus.
  2. Bias for Shipping – Deliver iteratively; perfect is the enemy of good.
  3. Ownership at Every Level – When you see a gap, you take action.

Role Summary – Core Developer

  1. Core Developers at Seamless Protocol serve the DAO and community by contributing across the stack to drive the protocol forward. They bring:
  2. Deep DeFi knowledge and extensive smart contract development experience.
  3. Strong computer science fundamentals and up-to-date blockchain expertise.
  4. A proactive mindset, anticipating challenges and designing innovative solutions.
  5. Clear communication skills and the ability to collaborate with engineers, PMs, and designers to prioritize and implement new features.
  6. A commitment to building secure, efficient, and user-friendly products aligned with Seamless’s mission.
  7. With strong technical skills and a high sense of ownership, Core Developers play a crucial role in shaping the future of DeFi and sustaining Seamless’s growth in a rapidly evolving blockchain ecosystem.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Responsibilities

  1. Develop and maintain data pipelines, backend services, and frontend interfaces that support core protocol functionality.
  2. Collaborate with core contributors and community members to define, scope, and prioritize new protocol features and enhancements.
  3. Produce clear, comprehensive documentation for smart contracts, backend systems, data queries, and frontend integrations.
  4. Assist community members in creating on-chain payloads for governance proposals submitted to the DAO.
  5. Conduct rigorous testing and perform internal audits to ensure the protocol’s security, stability, and reliability.
  6. Stay current with emerging trends, tools, and best practices in DeFi, blockchain engineering, and smart contract development.
  7. Work closely with the Seamless community across Discord, Discourse, and GitHub to support development efforts and coordinate improvements.
  8. Design and implement core smart contracts for the Seamless DeFi protocol using Solidity.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Qualifications

  1. Deep understanding of DeFi concepts, protocols, and the broader ecosystem.
  2. Experience with backend development using Node.js, Go, or similar technologies.
  3. Experience with frontend development using React.js.
  4. Hands-on experience with blockchain data tools such as The Graph, Dune, etc.
  5. Familiarity with foundational DeFi protocols (e.g., Uniswap, Compound, Aave).
  6. Familiarity with blockchain development frameworks and libraries such as Foundry, OpenZeppelin, and related tooling.
  7. Working knowledge of Solidity and experience interacting with on-chain protocols.
  8. Excellent problem-solving abilities and strong critical thinking skills, especially when dealing with complex, interconnected systems.
  9. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with a distributed, global team.
  10. Passion for DeFi and a commitment to building transparent, secure, and user-friendly products.
  11. Experience working in small, agile teams or startup-like environments.

Location

  1. Candidates must be based in a North American time zone.

Interview Process

  1. Hiring Manager Interview – 15–30 minutes
  2. Technical Interview – 1 hour
  3. Technical Interview – 1 hour
  4. Behavioral Interview – 45 minutes

Hiring Criteria

  1. Strong understanding of DeFi concepts, protocols, and ecosystem dynamics.
  2. Experience in both backend and frontend development using Node.js, Go, React.js, or equivalent technologies
  3. (e.g., Rust for backend, Angular for frontend is also acceptable).
  4. Familiarity with major DeFi protocols such as Uniswap, Compound, Aave, as well as blockchain data tools like The Graph and Dune.
  5. Familiarity with blockchain development tools including Foundry, OpenZeppelin, and similar frameworks.
  6. Comfortable writing Solidity and working directly with on-chain smart contracts.

title: Solidity Smart Contract Engineer -Multiliquid
location: US only (preference for onsite/hybrid in LA)

jobsdetail.description:
Description

About Uniform Labs


We are an on-chain financial infrastructure company backed by leading VCs including Strobe Fund, CMT Digital, Metalayer VC, The Venture Dept, and Generative Ventures. We're upgrading financial markets through 24/7 instant settlement. Our first product is Multiliquid, an institutional-grade smart contract protocol that facilitates interoperability and liquidity across tokenized financial assets and stablecoins. Our mission is to bridge traditional finance (TradFi) assets and decentralised finance (DeFi) in a transparent, efficient, and highly scalable way, ultimately replatforming all of financial markets on 10x better infrastructure in the form of blockchain.


Role Overview


We're looking for a Smart Contract Developer to join our core engineering team. In this hands-on role, you'll design, develop, and deploy secure smart contracts that power the Multiliquid protocol. You'll architect on-chain logic, optimize gas efficiency, ensure security best practices, and build the foundational infrastructure that enables institutional-grade DeFi operations. This is an opportunity to shape the core protocol layer of institutional DeFi, building robust, auditable smart contracts that handle significant liquidity flows across multiple chains.


You will work on a small, rigorously selected, senior team of engineers. You will be responsible for collaborating closely with product, compliance, security auditors, and business stakeholders. This is a high-impact role requiring deep technical expertise in blockchain development, strong security mindset, strategic thinking, and a passion for delivering best-in-class DeFi solutions.


Key Responsibilities

Smart Contract Development

Design, develop, test, and deploy secure smart contracts in Solidity for the Multiliquid protocol using Foundry.

Implement complex DeFi primitives including liquidity pools, cross-chain bridges, access control mechanisms, and institutional-grade financial logic.

Write clean, well-documented, gas-optimized code that adheres to industry best practices and established design patterns.


Protocol Architecture

Architect scalable, modular smart contract systems that support evolving protocol requirements.

Design upgradeable contract patterns and governance mechanisms for protocol evolution.

Collaborate with the engineering team to define on-chain/off-chain boundaries and integration points.


Security & Auditing

Conduct thorough internal security reviews and testing of smart contracts before deployment.

Work closely with external auditors to address findings and implement recommended security improvements.

Proactively identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities, attack vectors, and edge cases.

Stay current with emerging security threats and best practices in the DeFi ecosystem.


Testing & Quality Assurance

Write comprehensive unit tests, integration tests, and fuzzing tests for all smart contract code.

Develop test suites that cover edge cases, failure scenarios, and adversarial conditions.

Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to maintain high code quality standards.


Cross-Chain & Integration Work

Implement cross-chain messaging protocols and bridge integrations to enable multi-chain liquidity flows.

Collaborate with full-stack engineers to ensure seamless integration between smart contracts and front-end/back-end systems.

Design and document contract interfaces (ABIs) that enable efficient off-chain interaction.


Hands-On Engineering

Actively write and deploy smart contract code to mainnet and testnets.

Lead the development of core protocol features and upgrades.

Monitor deployed contracts, respond to on-chain events, and troubleshoot issues in production environments.

Prototype, iterate, and optimize rapidly in a fast-moving environment.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Why Join Us?

Impact: Help shape the user experience and interface of the future liquidity layer for tokenized finance.

Innovation: Work on real-world blockchain integrations powering institutional-grade capital flows.

Learning: Expand your understanding of DeFi, tokenized assets, and decentralized infrastructure.

Team: Join a collaborative, mission-driven team backed by top investors.

Upside: Competitive salary, equity upside, and the chance to be an early builder of a transformative protocol.


Compensation & Package

Base Salary + Equity

Interview Process

1.Founder / CEO Interview

2.Founder / CEO Interview

3.Technical Interview

4.Final Interview

title: Senior Backend Engineer-M0

jobsdetail.description:
M0 is a stablecoin platform for builders. With M0, developers can create their stablecoins in minutes by extending $M - M0’s superior digital-dollar building block, and customize attributes such as branding, compliance behaviors, and yield distribution mechanics. By extending $M into their own stablecoin, businesses can monetize their digital dollar use cases and maintain control over their money tech stack, while not being burdened by operational heavy-lifting.


M0 is seeking an experienced Protocol Backend Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will enhance the growing set of $M Extensions projects, support partners' technical teams, improve existing products, and create and maintain comprehensive documentation.


Key Responsibilities:

  1. ​​Design and develop automated onchain minting and cross-chain stablecoin liquidity management solutions.
  2. Deploy modern web applications using best practices to ensure security, compliance, security, and high availability.
  3. Implement monitoring and alerting systems to deliver high-uptime, low-latency user experiences.
  4. Mentor mid-level engineers, conduct code reviews, and foster a culture of knowledge sharing and best practices.
  5. Promote engineering excellence and agile practices to deliver projects on schedule and within budget.
jobsdetail.benefits:

Competitive compensation (base salary with equity/ token grant) commensurate with experience.

  3. Customizable IT setup: Tailor your workspace with access to top-notch IT equipment.
  4. Professional development: Benefit from an annual development budget to enhance your skills and grow professionally, including opportunities to participate in conferences and on-site company events worldwide.


Compensation & Package

Base Salary + Equity/Tokens

  5. Final Interview

About company:


About M0

M0 is a universal stablecoin platform. With M0, builders can create their own stablecoins by using M0’s platform, and customize attributes such as branding, compliance behaviors, and yield distribution mechanics. By leveraging M0, businesses can monetize their digital dollar use cases and maintain control over their money tech stack, while not being burdened by operational heavy-lifting.

Unlike traditional stablecoin models, M0 is built as an open multi-issuer framework that delivers seamless interoperability between $M and its extensions, but also allows builders of custom stablecoins to upgrade into their own issuers and not depend on anyone else for issuance.

M0 redefines the stablecoin landscape by eliminating traditional barriers to issuance, enabling an open and composable financial ecosystem where businesses and developers can create, customize, and scale their digital dollar solutions with unmatched flexibility. As a neutral and transparent protocol, M0 ensures that stablecoin liquidity remains fluid, accessible, and optimized for efficiency—laying the groundwork for a more decentralized and resilient financial system.

Headquarters

Germany

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Onramp ( BATON CORP)

jobsdetail.description:
Description

Location: New York, NY (Full-Time, In-Person)

Company: Baton Corporation


Who We Are


We’re Baton Corporation, a team of elite builders moving fast and redefining what’s possible.

We’re a high-growth software company and proud contributors to pump.fun, the world’s largest crypto social network. We build for the future.


What You’ll Do


As a Backend Engineer, you’ll design and scale the fintech and crypto systems powering seamless fiat ↔ crypto flows, real-time risk decisions, and rock-solid financial records.


You will:


  1. Own payment orchestration for bank rails (ACH, RTP, FedNow, SEPA, Open Banking) and cards (Apple Pay, Google Pay) with idempotent, fault-tolerant APIs and webhook processing.
  2. Integrate third-party providers (Plaid, TrueLayer, Tink, Stripe, Checkout.com, Adyen, Chainalysis, TRM, Travel Rule networks) behind clean, reliable interfaces.
  3. Build a real-time risk engine (<300ms) combining rules, ML scores, device signals, sanctions/KYC hits, and blockchain analytics to drive GREEN/AMBER/RED outcomes.
  4. Implement KYC/AML primitives (CIP/CDD, sanctions/PEP screening, Travel Rule data, audit-ready journaling) in close partnership with Compliance.
  5. Ship a double-entry ledger and reconciliation system tying together processors, bank statements, and on-chain balances with daily break detection and automated remediation.
  6. Deliver crypto to user wallets safely and fast (e.g., USDC/SOL), managing hot-wallet flow, transaction creation, confirmations, and operational safeguards.
  7. Raise the bar on reliability — SLOs, circuit breakers, retries, DLQs, shadow traffic, and canary releases.
  8. Instrument everything with traces, metrics, and logs. Build internal ops & compliance dashboards and participate in on-call for a 24/7 system.
  9. Collaborate cross-functionally with product, mobile, compliance, risk, and finance to take features from concept to production.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Why Join Us


If you thrive in chaos, love ambitious problems, and want to build something game-changing, we want to hear from you.


At our core, we believe in:

  1. ⚡ Speed over perfection — ship now, iterate later.
  2. 🧠 Ownership over bureaucracy — everyone makes big decisions.
  3. 💎 Talent density over headcount — we hire the best, no exceptions.
  4. 🌍 Building for the future — crypto moves fast, and so do we.

Base Salary + Equity/Tokens

title: Product Lead (Morpho Prime) -Morpho Labs

jobsdetail.description:
Description

Morpho is a leading Decentralized Finance (DeFi) lending protocol that recently secured $50 million in funding from Ribbit Capital, a16z crypto, Coinbase Ventures, Variant, Brevan Howard, Pantera, Blocktower, and 50 others to support its mission of revolutionizing lending with an open, efficient, and resilient platform. Morpho is experiencing explosive growth, with over $9 billion in assets supplied on the protocol, solidifying itself as the new standard for DeFi lending. Now, Morpho is scaling its team of contributors to establish itself as a cornerstone, not just of DeFi, but of a new internet-native financial system.


Location

Paris or remote (from GMT -5 up to GMT +2 to ensure sufficient overlap with the rest of the team).


Mission & Responsibilities

We’re looking for a Product Lead to drive Morpho’s Prime Products vertical.


You’ll work with engineering, design, data and protocol teams to set strategy, ship industry-shaping products and help Curators and Advanced Users interact with Morpho’s protocol.

To do so, you will need to develop a deep understanding of Morpho’s protocol and products, various stakeholders, the market, competitors and the wider Defi and lending industry as a whole.


Specifically, you will:

Understand Morpho’s various stakeholders, their needs and requirements,

Deeply understand the wider crypto lending space, both Centralized and Decentralized,

Execute on the product vision and strategy with a world-class engineering team,

Shape the products that Curators, Institutions and Pro users use to manage risk and exposure.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Must-have Experience & Skills

Job requirements

5+ years of experience building and shipping products in the Crypto Lending or Trading space,

Understanding of technical web development fundamentals (APIs, SDKs…),

Understanding of Risk Management and trade execution in crypto and DeFi,

Experience working with large institutions, funds or capital allocators in Defi or Finance,

Experience working directly with Engineering teams to deliver 0-to-1 products,

Exceptional organization and communication skills,

Low-ego, high-ownership mindset.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Screening question: ( Send email admin@ant-tech.asia)

Does the candidate have 5+ years of experience building and shipping products in the Crypto Lending or Trading space?

Please provide brief details.

Does the candidate have a solid understanding of technical web development fundamentals (e.g. APIs, SDKs, etc.)?

Please describe their level of proficiency.

Does the candidate have an understanding of Risk Management and trade execution in crypto and DeFi?

Please provide examples if applicable.

Does the candidate have experience working with large institutions, funds, or capital allocators in DeFi or traditional finance?

If yes, please specify.

Additional Information

How well do you know this candidate?

e.g. former colleague, direct manager, referral, etc.)

What is the candidate’s current location (city and country)?

What is the candidate’s work authorization status?

(e.g. Based in the US and does not require visa sponsorship.)

Please specify a range.

When is the candidate available to start a new position?

e.g. immediately, 2 weeks, 4 weeks, etc.)

Is there any additional information you would like to highlight about this candidate?

(Optional – cover note)


About Morpho Labs

Overview and Mission

Morpho Labs is the development company behind Morpho, a leading decentralized lending protocol. Its mission is to make financial infrastructure a public good by providing an open, efficient, and resilient platform for on-chain loans. Morpho enables anyone to earn yield or borrow crypto assets permissionlessly, while also allowing developers and businesses to build custom lending markets and vaults on its infrastructure.


Since launch, Morpho has grown into one of the largest DeFi lending systems (≈$6 B in deposits as of mid-2025) operating on Ethereum and other chains. Its vision is to become a cornerstone of a new internet-native financial system by fusing DeFi lending with traditional fintech.


Product Offerings

Morpho offers a suite of lending/borrowing products and developer tools built around its smart-contract protocol:


Consumer Products (Earn/Borrow):

Retail users can deposit assets into Morpho Vaults to earn optimized interest, or post collateral to borrow other tokens. Morpho optimizes yields by peer-to-peer matching within its vaults on top of base pools like Aave/Compound. Borrowers enjoy higher collateral limits and no protocol fees.


Curate/Vaults (Prime):

Power users and institutions can deploy custom vaults and lending markets. The Curate interface lets “vault curators” configure collateral types, interest models, and risk parameters, earning fees for supplying liquidity. These vaults are open, customizable, and scalable, benefiting from Morpho’s liquidity and matching engine. This is powered by the “Morpho Blue” protocol — a minimal core lending engine designed for security and flexibility.


Developer Tools (Infra):

Morpho provides on-chain and off-chain infrastructure for developers. A public GraphQL API and SDK libraries let applications query Morpho data and integrate lending functions. Enterprises can build their own lending use cases on Morpho’s stack, benefitting from audited, formally-verified contracts and DevOps tools.


Morpho infrastructure underpins notable integrations — for example, Coinbase’s on-chain lending launched in early 2025 uses Morpho on the Base chain to offer crypto-backed loans through the Coinbase app.


Funding History

Morpho Labs has raised approximately $70 M in venture funding (mostly through token sales):

Seed Round (Oct 2021): ~$1.35 M, led by Semantic Ventures and Nascent

Strategic Round (July 2022): $18 M, co-led by a16z Crypto and Variant

Strategic Round (Aug 2024): $50 M, led by Ribbit Capital with a16z, Coinbase Ventures, Pantera, Brevan Howard, BlockTower, Kraken Ventures, and others

These funds are supporting growth on Ethereum and expansion to new chains.


Team Structure and Leadership

Morpho Labs is structured with both for-profit and nonprofit entities, but engineering is centralized under the development company.

The engineering organization is divided into smart-contract and off-chain teams. Core protocol development is handled by a small group focused on Morpho Blue, vaults, and oracles. A separate infrastructure/API team manages backend services and the public API. The Head of Engineering will lead this off-chain group and help scale engineering practices.


Technology Stack and Culture

Morpho emphasizes security, minimalism, and modern DevOps:

On-chain: Solidity (Morpho Blue is ~600 LOC), fully audited, formally verified, $2.5M bug bounty

Off-chain: TypeScript (Node.js), Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform, GraphQL API

Dev Culture: Research-driven, collaborative, with open discussion and weekly “DeFi School” sessions

Engineers are encouraged to deeply threat-model and simplify systems. Most work is remote-friendly with periodic in-person bootcamps.

Recent Updates (Past 12 Months)

Corporate Restructuring: Morpho Labs SAS merged into the Morpho Association nonprofit; all equity transferred to the DAO.

Coinbase Partnership: Coinbase launched on-chain lending powered by Morpho on Base.

Token Unlock: MORPHO governance token became transferable in late 2024.

Growth: Deposits have scaled to ~$6 B; ongoing protocol upgrades and mobile features released.


Open Source and Community Contributions

Morpho’s contracts and tools are open source under a dual license. The GitHub organization hosts:

Morpho Blue (core protocol)

Vaults, oracles, and rewards contracts

TypeScript SDKs for integration

Developer documentation and tooling

They also regularly publish lending protocol research and offer one of the largest bug bounties in DeFi.

Locations and Remote Policy


Morpho Labs is based in Paris, with a remote-friendly culture. Team members work across Europe and North America (GMT-5 to GMT+2 time zones). Roles are open to remote engineers with occasional meetups at the Paris HQ.


Resources

Fundraise

https://www.theblock.co/post/308866/ribbit-capital-50-million-raise-morpho-labs

Dune

https://dune.com/morpho/gmorpho-dashboard

Morpho's Mission

https://morpho.mirror.xyz/Df_r4-mDzR-xFLA3P3amuhzwq4GjuuNOnOiiVizx6ZU

Nansen - Guide to Morpho

https://www.nansen.ai/post/what-is-morpho

title: Software Engineer - Fullstack (Web3 dApp Development)- Sei Labs Inc

jobsdetail.description:
Updated the hiring criteria for this role - they have at least 3 open positions and is very urgent!

Important: Please read the following before referring candidates

Must be able to do NYC 2-3 days a week. They're happy to look at backend focused or full stack. Not pure frontend.

Description

About Sei

Sei Labs builds open sourced technology for the high-performance Sei Blockchain, the first parallelized EVM Layer 1 blockchain designed to scale with the industry. The unique optimizations built into Sei enable Web3 applications to reach Web2 level scale and performance, driving the mass adoption of digital assets.

Our teams are comprised of former Google, Goldman Sachs, Robinhood, Nvidia, and Databricks veterans dedicated to onboarding the next billion users onto a vibrant ecosystem of applications.

Sei Labs has raised over $30M from top investors including Jump Crypto, Multicoin Capital, Coinbase Ventures, Distributed Global, Hudson River Trading, and Flow Traders.

We're a globally distributed team with a fully remote workforce. Check out our website and docs for more details.

Fullstack Engineering at Sei

Sei Labs is looking for a Fullstack Engineer to help shape the future of Web3 by empowering innovative, high-impact applications across the Sei Blockchain. You'll work with a team at the forefront of blockchain technology, collaborating closely with our ecosystem partners to develop cutting-edge dApps spanning diverse Web3 domains (from DEX’s and games, to DePin, AI and beyond). If you're passionate about constant learning, rapid development, and making a tangible impact in a fast-paced, community-first environment, this is a unique opportunity to push the boundaries of what's possible in decentralized technology.
jobsdetail.requirement:

3+ years of experience with full-stack development, with a focus on backend and API's

1+ years working in Web3 with production grade Solidity contracts

Proficiency with one of Go / Typescript

Experience with database management using SQL, NoSQL, or similar technologies

Experience with cloud technologies such as AWS, Terraform

● Phối hợp với đội Sales trong giai đoạn tiền bán hàng của các dự án.

● Thực hiện các buổi lắng nghe và thu thập yêu cầu từ khách hàng, làm rõ nhu cầu nghiệp vụ và kỹ thuật.

● Nghiên cứu và xây dựng các đề xuất kỹ thuật chi tiết phù hợp với yêu cầu của khách hàng.

● Chuẩn bị ước tính chi phí, nguồn lực và lập kế hoạch dự án phối hợp cùng đội phát triển offshore.

● Hỗ trợ đội Delivery trong giai đoạn khởi động dự án (khi cần thiết).

● Đón tiếp và giới thiệu Công ty và dự án đến khách hàng tại Offshore Quản lý đội nhóm tiếng Nhật

● Quản lý nhóm Comtor/BrSE/BA tiếng Nhật của công ty.

● Phân công nhiệm vụ, theo dõi tiến độ và đảm bảo chất lượng dịch thuật – giao tiếp dự án.

● Đào tạo, coaching, nâng cao năng lực chuyên môn cho thành viên trong team.

● Là cầu nối giữa team tiếng Nhật và các bộ phận kỹ thuật – đảm bảo thông tin thông suốt.

● Khả năng quản lý đội nhóm

● Kỹ năng giao tiếp – thuyết trình – đàm phán tốt.

● Hiểu biết về ngành IT, quy trình dự án phần mềm là lợi thế.

● Hỗ trợ cơm ca 500,000/tháng cho nhân viên chính thức

● Chính sách đào tạo chuyên sâu, cơ hội onsite Nhật Bản cho nhân viên tiềm năng

● Chế độ thưởng lễ, Tết, sinh nhật, báo hỷ… cho từng cá nhân

● Chính sách rèn luyện thể thao cho CBNV

● Team building theo quý – Company trip mỗi năm

● Chính sách cơm ca cho nhân viên OT

● Happy Hour mỗi tháng với nhiều phần quà hấp dẫn

title: Staff Software Engineer - Execution Team- Hashgraph

jobsdetail.description:
About Hashgraph:


Hashgraph is a fast-growing software company committed to supporting, developing and servicing Hedera, an open source, proof-of-stake platform. Hedera is EVM-compatible and has been specifically built to meet the needs of enterprise and Web3 applications, which require speed, security, stability and sustainability. Hedera’s public network is governed by industry-leading organizations, spanning 11 sectors and 14 regions who oversee the development and direction of the decentralised platform.


About The Team:


The Execution Team is one of the core teams that builds and maintains the Hiero Consensus Node, the heart of the Hiero Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT). Our team is responsible for delivering the Hiero native services, which include the Crypto, Token, Consensus, and File Services. We also own transaction processing, fee collection, rewards accounting, and distribution. Furthermore, the generation of records and blocks is part of our responsibility. Our team works primarily in Java, and our code is open source. We collaborate closely with internal and external partners to deliver a reliable, performant, scalable, secure, fault-tolerant, and developer-friendly platform.


About the role:


As a Staff Software Engineer, you’ll be a technical leader on the Execution Team, responsible for delivering software services, business logic, and APIs within the Hiero Consensus Node. You’ll work on deeply technical challenges involving distributed execution, state management, transaction lifecycles, and economic systems (fees, rewards, and penalties). You will work in a highly collaborative environment where innovation, trust, and ownership are key values. This is a high-impact role requiring deep passion for building the platform that powers next-generation decentralised applications.


You may find yourself doing all of the following:

Design, develop, test and debug core components of the execution layer

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and deliver end-to-end functionality

Optimize performance and scalability of the execution layer for high-throughput transaction workloads

Ensure correctness, determinism, and reliability in service implementations

Drive high standards in code quality, testing, and documentation

Mentor engineers and contribute to a culture of technical excellence and open-source collaboration
jobsdetail.requirements:

7+ years of professional software engineering experience, including in a senior or staff-level role

Strong expertise in Java, with a deep understanding of concurrent programming and system performance

Strong grasp of computer science fundamentals, including data structures, algorithms, concurrency, and design patterns

Experience building and maintaining distributed systems at scale

Experience with API design, particularly gRPC

Strong problem-solving and debugging skills

Experience in profiling and optimising complex and concurrent systems

Excellent communication and collaboration skills

Having a passion for code quality, system design, and doing things the right way

Other skills that are great to bring with you but that we can help you develop:

Experience in distributed ledger Technologies (DLT) or blockchain platforms

Exposure to security principles in distributed applications or cryptographic systems

Familiarity with web3 tools or smart contract platforms (especially EVM)

Experience with event-driven architectures or high-frequency trading systems

Description

Who We Are:

We build infrastructure that delivers massive amounts of web data to the companies training the world’s most powerful AI models.

We're the team that helps to power and support Grass, a bandwidth-sharing network that lets us operate a massive distributed crawler, giving us unique access to high-quality public web data at global scale. On top of that, we’ve built pipelines for ingesting, segmenting, and annotating billions of videos, transcripts, and audio files, powering dataset creation for frontier labs.

We’re lean, technical, and move fast. No red tape, no slow decision-making; just a team of builders pushing to expand what’s possible for open web data and AI.


The Role.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer (Backend) who is experienced and brings deep expertise in backend development. You will join a small, talented team and lead efforts to architect scalable solutions, drive technical excellence, and support our vision for a future where Grass plays a critical role in shaping the internet's evolution.

Information

Banking / Insurance

The company

Gottex Brokers is the leading interdealer broker in interest rate derivative products across continental Europe. Based in Lausanne, Switzerland, we provide a service of excellence to our customers worldwide with particular acclaim for our Swiss Franc and Scandinavian interest rate derivatives and fixed income products.

With over 30 years of industry experience, we offer a bespoke service while maintaining the highest levels of professionalism and integrity. We have a dynamic, multinational team of experienced and highly qualified employees providing local expertise to our international client base.

As the global reference for Swiss Franc interest rate derivatives, and a dominant force in the Scandinavian markets, we offer unrivalled, customized solutions to our clients, while maintaining the highest levels of professionalism and integrity.

Our experienced and internationally diverse team serves to reinforce the strength of our brand, which has been a hallmark of the OTC derivatives business since its foundation in 1986.


Corporate culture


Excellence in execution.

We bring an outstanding and personalised service with a long-lasting commitment to our clients through a deep-rooted family culture, imbued with respect and shared values.


Note more:

Attention – Restricted Target Companies

The client has identified specific companies from which active poaching is strictly forbidden. Only passive approaches are allowed for the following institutions: Tradition, Conticap, and Starcb / banks.

Candidate Profile – Key Requirements

Experience within the Inter-Dealer Broker sector is strongly desired. Candidates must come from competitors, and active headhunting is required except for the restricted companies listed above. Banker profiles are not acceptable.

Experience in the following companies would be considered a strong advantage: Martin Brokers, Bondpartners, Bridport, Valcourt, Kepler Cheuvreux, Tullett Prebon, BGC, GFI Group, Pareto Securities AG, Aurel, BGC Freedom International Brokerage, Stifel Schweiz AG, and Louis Capital.

Flexibility and Compensation

Compensation is open to negotiation depending on the candidate’s experience and existing client portfolio. The candidate must already manage an established client book. There is flexibility on remuneration based on the seniority of the candidate and the size and quality of their client portfolio.

Administrative Constraints

The client does not accept candidates who require administrative procedures for a work permit or residence permit. Only candidates already authorized to work in the relevant location will be considered.

Position – Projects, Issues and Priorities

The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of financial markets, with a specific focus on FX Forward CHF. Long-standing and existing relationships with interbank traders are mandatory, with the ability to leverage these relationships immediately.

There is no possibility of promotion associated with this position.

Organization and Reporting Line

The team consists of six people. This role does not include any management responsibilities. The position reports directly to the Head of IRS Desk.

title: Senior Account Executive, Financial Institutions & Banks -Conduit

jobsdetail.description:
Conduit is seeking a Director of Banking Sales to drive commercial growth by selling our cross-border payments and infrastructure solutions to banks, including Tier 1 institutions to regional and community banks. This is a senior, high-impact role for someone who understands how banks operate, has a strong existing network across the U.S. banking ecosystem, and can independently generate new opportunities and relationships.


You’ll lead the go-to-market strategy for the banking segment - creating compelling sales materials, building tailored solution proposals, and working hand-in-hand with product, compliance, and engineering teams to design and implement bespoke cross-border payment flows. This role combines strategic sales leadership with technical and operational fluency, ideal for someone who can sell to banks and speak their language.


We’re looking for a builder: someone entrepreneurial, execution-oriented, and equally comfortable in a boardroom with banking c-suite as in the weeds with a payments operations team.


Key Responsibilities


Own the banking sales pipeline: Build and manage a robust pipeline of bank relationships across Tier 1, regional, and community banks. Drive the full sales lifecycle from outreach to closing.

Develop strategic relationships: Leverage your existing network to establish and expand partnerships that enable Conduit’s global cross-border payment flows.

Design and present solutions: Create compelling commercial proposals and payment flow structures aligned with each bank’s technical, compliance, and operational frameworks.

Lead sales enablement: Develop and refine sales collateral, pitch decks, and product positioning to effectively communicate Conduit’s value to financial institutions.

Collaborate cross-functionally: Work closely with compliance, legal, product, and engineering to ensure proposed solutions align with regulatory and operational requirements.

Guide onboarding and implementation: Partner with internal teams to ensure smooth bank integration, onboarding, and go-live processes, with a focus on client satisfaction and retention.

Drive outbound business development: Proactively identify and pursue new banking relationships — you’ll be expected to build and manage your own outbound pipeline.

Represent Conduit externally: Attend industry events, conferences, and client meetings to enhance Conduit’s visibility within the U.S. and global banking and fintech ecosystem.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Qualifications


Experience: 8+ years in enterprise sales or partnership roles focused on financial institutions — preferably in payments, fintech infrastructure, or B2B SaaS.

Banking network: Strong relationships across U.S. banks (Tier 1, regional, and community), with a proven ability to originate and close high-value partnerships.

Technical fluency: Solid understanding of how banks operate — core banking systems, payment rails (ACH, Fedwire, SWIFT, RTP), compliance, and treasury operations.

Sales leadership: Proven success designing sales strategies, structuring complex deals, and working cross-functionally to deliver client-ready solutions.

Entrepreneurial mindset: A self-starter who thrives in ambiguity, builds from scratch, and moves quickly from idea to execution.

Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, able to engage credibly with C-suite executives and technical stakeholders alike.

Bonus: Experience in cross-border payments, correspondent banking, or stablecoin-based payment infrastructure.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Requirements summary

Senior/Director Banking Sales, 8+ yrs, Must: FI enterprise sales, US bank network (Tier1/regional/community), cross-border payments, payment rails ACH/Fedwire/SWIFT/RTP, compliance & treasury ops, complex deal structuring & GTM, fintech infra/B2B SaaS, Remote (US)

This is a high priority for Grass and they want to see more profiles!

Recruiting Tips
They like to see candidates from companies such as Hughes.

Who We Are:

We build infrastructure that delivers massive amounts of web data to the companies training the world’s most powerful AI models.

We're the team that helps to power and support Grass, a bandwidth-sharing network that lets us operate a massive distributed crawler, giving us unique access to high-quality public web data at global scale. On top of that, we’ve built pipelines for ingesting, segmenting, and annotating billions of videos, transcripts, and audio files, powering dataset creation for frontier labs.

We’re lean, technical, and move fast. No red tape, no slow decision-making; just a team of builders pushing to expand what’s possible for open web data and AI.

The Role.

We are looking for a talented Network Infrastructure Engineer to join our team with experience working with infrastructure and network architecture design . In this role, you will be responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure that powers our AI-driven platform. You will work closely with our engineering and product teams to deploy physical infrastructure at our data centre to ensure that our systems are scalable, secure, and reliable. Your work will directly impact the efficiency and performance of our platform, enabling us to deliver cutting-edge solutions at scale.

Who You Are.

Proven experience designing networks and maintaining physical infrastructure.

About Grass

Grass is the world’s first Layer 2 Data Rollup. It exists as a source for AI training data, which it obtains from public websites using a vast network of web scraping nodes. These nodes are operated voluntarily by residential internet users, and users are rewarded for their participation. Data procured on the network is then cleaned and processed into structured datasets before being added to Grass’s growing data repository for use in AI training.

location: EST Preferred, will consider strong candidates in PST to GMT, but they must be willing to work majority EST hours.

jobsdetail.description:
Updated the location requirements;

EST Preferred, will consider strong candidates in PST to GMT, but they must be willing to work majority EST hours.

Agora have paused this whilst the Head of Talent is OOO, by all means share people still but they wont be reviewed until earliest 13/01

Description

At Agora, our mission is to transform how money moves. We believe stablecoins will underpin a new financial fabric, one that is faster, more global, and more efficient than today’s siloed systems. That is why we are building AUSD and the Agora stack, a full service platform that makes issuing, managing, and integrating stablecoins seamless – whether you’re a developer, fintech, or institution. With AUSD, stablecoins become programmable, composable, and ubiquitous by default.

We believe digital dollars should be a public good: trusted, accessible, and built for real-world utility. Our mission is to drive adoption through customizable, user-friendly on-ramps that make stable, dollar-based value available on-chain.

We’re backed by world-class investors including Paradigm and Dragonfly, and we’re growing a team to reimagine how value moves online.

We're intentional about who we bring on. If you’re passionate about stablecoins and want to help create more open, intuitive ways for people to engage with money, let’s talk.

ABOUT THE TEAM

We bring the discipline of high-performance finance teams and the creativity of a fast-moving crypto-native startup. We’re a small, mission-driven group of builders who move fast, sweat the details, and hold a high bar for excellence — in product, code, and culture.

You’ll be joining a tight-knit team that values clear thinking, extreme ownership, and high-velocity decision making. We operate in short feedback loops, support one another without ego, and are deeply motivated by the opportunity to build foundational infrastructure for the future of money.

JOB SUMMARY

We’re seeking a Senior Backend Engineer to accelerate the delivery of both internal tools and customer-facing products. In this role, you will design, build, and operate backend services with a strong focus on reliability, performance, and developer experience. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams, taking ownership of critical systems while shaping technical standards and ensuring operational excellence. Our stack includes TypeScript, REST APIs, Docker, Kubernetes, Prometheus, and Grafana.

title: Founding Engineer (Full Stack) – AI Platform for Litigation w/ 0.25%–1.0% Equity- Crimson
location: London, UK (3+ days/week in-office near Bank)

jobsdetail.description:
Job Overview

As a Founding Engineer (Full Stack) for our AI Platform for Litigation, you'll play a crucial role in designing and implementing a cutting-edge system tailored for high-stakes legal environments. You'll work closely with legal professionals to integrate AI-driven solutions that enhance litigation processes. Comprehensive Stack Contribution: Lead initiatives across cloud infrastructure, Python backend, and Next.js frontend, while managing large datasets with PostgreSQL and Azure-hosted LLMs. ...


Responsibilities

This is a founding full-stack engineering role. You’ll join Crimson as one of the first employees and help build the AI platform that powers litigation at leading UK and US law firms.


What you’ll do:

• Contribute across the entire stack, from cloud infrastructure to prompting to UX – including Python backend, Next.js + TypeScript frontend, PostgreSQL, and Azure-hosted LLM workloads with CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, IaC such as Bicep).

• Collaborate closely with litigators and knowledge workers to understand how lawyers work, what they need, and how Crimson can fit into their workflows.

• Architect and scale document ingestion and processing pipelines to power fast, accurate search, summarisation and data extraction over large volumes of legal documents.

• Design and implement intelligent, multi-step agent workflows that can autonomously handle complex legal tasks – from surfacing key testimony to generating fact chronologies and spotting inconsistencies in filings.

• Design and bring to life intuitive, AI-native user experiences tailored to litigation workflows, in partnership with the founders and early customers.

• Improve system performance, stability and observability as we scale to more cases, larger datasets and additional firms.

• Help shape our engineering culture and team – from best practices and code standards to interviewing, hiring and mentoring future engineers.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Qualifications

3+ years of experience building and shipping production web applications (full-stack), ideally in startups or small, high-ownership teams.

Strong backend experience with Python (or similar), PostgreSQL and cloud infrastructure (Azure preferred; AWS or GCP also relevant).

Frontend experience with modern TypeScript frameworks (Next.js / React) and an eye for building clean, intuitive product experiences.

Experience designing and operating data pipelines or distributed systems that handle large volumes of text / documents.

Comfort working with LLMs and applied AI – prompting, integrating model APIs, and thinking carefully about correctness, reliability and UX for AI-powered features.

Excellent product judgement, communication skills and attention to detail – you’re comfortable talking to demanding users and turning their feedback into shipped features.

High agency and bias for shipping; you like owning problems end-to-end and seeing your work used in real cases.

Bonus: interest or background in legal tech, disputes, or working with professional services users.


Ideal Candidate

Ideal Candidate Profile


Driven and self-directed – you take ownership of hard problems, operate with high agency, and care deeply about getting to a great outcome for demanding users.

Product-obsessed full-stack builder – you’re as comfortable in Python/Postgres as you are in TypeScript/React, and you enjoy sweating the UX details that make AI feel reliable and usable.

User-centric communicator – you like talking to lawyers, partners and associates, translating messy workflows into clean technical systems, and iterating quickly based on feedback.

Excited by AI in high-stakes domains – you want to push the limits of LLMs in production while caring deeply about accuracy, security and reliability for billion-pound disputes.

Bonus: prior experience in legal tech, fintech, or other professional-services products where users are smart, time-poor, and extremely quality-sensitive.
