About company:

About the Company

Company Overview

Company Size: 5-10

Industry: AI-powered legaltech for litigation; software development

Specialties: Litigation, arbitration, dispute resolution, legal technology, and artificial intelligence

Founded: 2024

Headquarters: London, United Kingdom

Total Funding: US$500k+ pre-seed (Y Combinator and other investors; YC X25 batch)

https://www.crimson.law/


Our Mission

Crimson is an AI productivity platform built for litigators. Litigation teams use Crimson to analyze case files, answer case-specific questions and draft documents tailored to each dispute. By automating manual workflows across the life cycle of a case, Crimson helps lawyers find key evidence faster, streamline case management and save 10+ hours per week on common litigation tasks.


Company Culture


Crimson is a small, high-ownership team of three co-founders with deep technical and disputes expertise. They’re building a category-defining AI platform for high-stakes litigation, working with major UK and US law firms that trust them with highly sensitive case files. The culture is product-driven and security-obsessed: engineers talk directly to users, own features end-to-end, and care deeply about accuracy, reliability and speed. Backed by Y Combinator and other top investors, the team is focused on shipping quickly, learning from demanding users and setting a new standard for legal AI.


What you can expect

Day to Day

You’ll spend most of your time designing, building, and operating the full-stack systems that power Crimson’s AI platform for high-stakes litigation. Your work ships quickly to elite UK and US law firms and is used on live cases within days.


In practice, that looks like:


Contributing across the stack – from Python backend and document pipelines to Next.js + TypeScript frontend, PostgreSQL, and Azure-hosted LLM workloads (with IaC + CI/CD).

Collaborating directly with litigators and knowledge workers to understand how they run disputes today, where the bottlenecks are, and how Crimson can slot into their workflows.

Designing and scaling ingestion, search and summarisation pipelines over large volumes of pleadings, transcripts, evidence, and orders.

Building intelligent, multi-step agent workflows that automate complex legal tasks, while keeping humans in the loop for high-stakes decisions.

Iterating rapidly based on user feedback – instrumenting features, debugging real cases, and improving reliability and performance as more firms and matters come onto the platform.

Team

You’ll join a small, senior founding team that blends deep AI expertise with top-tier litigation experience.


Crimson was founded by Amine Amor (ML/AI specialist), David Strömbäck (AI engineer), and Mark Feldner (former BigLaw litigator).

You’ll work day-to-day with the technical founders on architecture, roadmap, and implementation, and partner closely with Mark to understand how litigators actually use the product in high-stakes cases.

The team is small, high-ownership, and product-driven – everyone ships code, talks to users, and has a strong voice in what gets built next.

Growth

This is a founding-level role with a lot of surface area and real upside:


Own major parts of Crimson’s architecture and product from day one and shape how the core litigation platform evolves over the coming years.

Help define engineering culture from scratch – everything from code standards and observability to how we run interviews and onboard future engineers.

Build deep relationships with elite UK and US law firms and see your work used on complex, cross-border disputes that matter.

Grow into a tech lead / founding-team engineering leader as the company scales – with meaningful equity in a YC-backed, category-defining legal AI company.


Interview Process

Intro Call (30 min) – Introductory conversation with one of the founders to learn more about your background, walk through Crimson’s product and users, and assess mutual fit.

Technical Deep Dive (60–75 min) – Live discussion with a founder covering your experience building and shipping full-stack products, system-design style questions, and how you’ve handled complex, real-world requirements.

Practical Exercise / Case Study (60–90 min) – Short take-home or live exercise focused on how you’d design and implement a Crimson-style feature (for example, a document ingestion + search workflow or an AI-assisted litigation task), followed by a review with the team.

Founder Round (60–90 min) – Conversations with the founding team to go deeper on collaboration style, product thinking, and mission alignment, plus any remaining technical topics.
jobsdetail.other:
Must-Have Requirements

3+ years of professional software engineering experience, building and shipping production web applications (full-stack).

Strong experience with Python and PostgreSQL on the backend, and TypeScript/Next.js (or similar React framework) on the frontend.

Track record of owning features end-to-end in a small, high-ownership or startup environment, including talking directly to users.

Based in (or willing to relocate to) London, with existing right to work in the UK and ability to be in the office at least 3 days per week.

Screening Questions ( send email admin@ant-tech.asia)

1. (Optional Video). This step is completely optional. If you’d like, record a short 2–3 minute video introducing yourself and your experience — or share a recording of your interview with the recruiter if that’s easier. You can upload the link via Loom or Google Drive. This just helps us get to know you better, but there’s no pressure if you’d prefer to skip it.

2. (Optional Portfolio / GitHub) If available, please share a link to your GitHub, portfolio, or any recent projects you’ve worked on. This is entirely optional but helps provide more context about your work.

3. Have you worked closely with demanding professional users (e.g. lawyers, finance, or similar) and built full-stack features end-to-end for them? Please share an example of a product or feature you owned, including how you gathered requirements and iterated after launch.

This is a founding AI / backend engineering role. You’ll design and ship the ML systems that power Closure’s “digital analyst” for law enforcement—working closely with the founders, Forward-Deployed Engineers, and investigators in the field.


What you will do:


Own core AI and backend systems that ingest, process, and search across large volumes of evidence (calls, reports, documents, transcripts, and more).

Design and implement retrieval / RAG pipelines for unstructured and structured data, making it fast and reliable for investigators to find what they need.

Contribute across the stack when needed (APIs, internal tools, evaluation dashboards) to keep the overall AI surface area robust, monitored, and maintainable.

Company Overview

Company Size: 5-10 employees

Industry:Govtech, public safety, law-enforcement technology, and AI / machine learning

Specialties: Digital evidence analysis, AI-powered transcription and translation, semantic search across case files, investigations and case management, criminal justice technology

Founded: 2024

Headquarters: New York, New York

https://www.closure-intel.com/


Our Mission

Closure helps law enforcement, prosecutors, attorneys, and investigators quickly find the truth in overwhelming volumes of digital evidence. Their “digital analyst” platform securely transcribes, translates, searches, organizes, and analyzes case files—such as jail communications, search-warrant returns, and scanned documents—across many languages. By turning evidence overload into clear, searchable insight, Closure lets agencies focus on solving cases and delivering accurate, fair justice instead of manually combing through data.

Company Culture

Closure is a small, seed-stage, YC-backed team built around mission-driven, high-ownership work in public safety. The founders are experienced engineers from Palantir and defense backgrounds who care deeply about helping government work better. The culture emphasizes thoughtful, field-driven product development with investigators and prosecutors, rapid iteration on real-world problems, and a high bar for reliability and trust in how AI is applied. Engineers are expected to be hands-on with users, comfortable with ambiguity, and motivated by impact rather than big-company structure.


What you can expect

Day to Day

You’ll spend your days designing, building, and operating the AI and backend systems that power Closure’s “digital analyst” for law enforcement.

In practice, that looks like:

• Owning core data and ML pipelines that ingest, process, and search across large volumes of evidence (calls, reports, transcripts, documents, etc.).

• Designing and implementing retrieval / RAG architectures over unstructured and structured data so investigators can reliably find what matters.

• Prototyping with new models and tools (LLMs, embeddings, vector databases, observability) and turning the best ideas into robust, production-ready systems.

• Partnering closely with Forward-Deployed Engineers and founders to turn field feedback from detectives and prosecutors into concrete ML features and ranking improvements.

• Contributing across the stack when needed — from APIs and job orchestration to evaluation dashboards and monitoring — to keep the entire AI surface area healthy.

Team

You’ll join a tiny, senior founding team of ex-Palantir and defense engineers who are obsessed with solving meaningful problems in public safety.

• You’ll report directly to Gilad Levy (Co-founder & CTO) and work closely with Aaron Zelinger (Co-founder) on architecture, roadmap, and product direction.

• You’ll collaborate tightly with Forward-Deployed Engineers who spend time in the field with investigators and bring back high-signal problems and feedback.

• The team is lean, highly technical, and mission-driven — everyone ships code, talks to users, and has a strong voice in what gets built next.

Growth

This is a founding-level AI role with a lot of surface area:

• Own major pieces of Closure’s AI and backend architecture from day one and shape how the digital analyst evolves over time.

• Define best practices for evaluating, monitoring, and hardening LLM / retrieval systems in high-stakes law-enforcement settings.

• Influence product strategy by connecting what’s technically possible with what investigators actually need in the field.

• Help hire and mentor future ML/AI engineers as the company grows, building out a small but world-class applied AI team.

• Build a rare track record of shipping real-world, high-impact AI systems at a YC-backed, public-safety-focused startup.


Initial Call (30 min)

– Introductory conversation with a founder to learn more about your background, walk through the role, and assess mutual fit.

Technical Deep Dive (60–75 min) – Live discussion with an engineer covering your experience building and shipping products, system-design style questions, and how you’ve handled messy real-world requirements.

Practical Exercise / Case Study (60–90 min) – Short take-home or live exercise focused on how you’d approach a forward-deployed problem (e.g., understanding a customer workflow and translating it into product/technical changes).

Final Round (60–90 min) – Conversations with founders and team members to go deeper on collaboration style, working with customers, mission alignment, and any remaining technical topics.
jobsdetail.other:

3+ years of professional software engineering experience, with strong backend fundamentals (distributed systems, APIs, data modeling) in a modern stack (e.g., Python + TypeScript/React or similar).

Hands-on experience building and shipping ML/AI systems, ideally with LLMs or other deep-learning models used by real users (not just research or prototypes).

Experience with retrieval / RAG or similar pipelines over unstructured text or multi-modal data (documents, audio transcripts, etc.), including designing data flows and evaluation approaches. (Based directly on the JD’s “Data Versatility / RAG or similar pipelines” section.)

New York, New York

https://www.closure-intel.com/


Our Mission

Closure helps law enforcement, prosecutors, attorneys, and investigators quickly find the truth in overwhelming volumes of digital evidence. Their “digital analyst” platform securely transcribes, translates, searches, organizes, and analyzes case files—such as jail communications, search-warrant returns, and scanned documents—across many languages. By turning evidence overload into clear, searchable insight, Closure lets agencies focus on solving cases and delivering accurate, fair justice instead of manually combing through data.

Company Culture

Closure is a small, seed-stage, YC-backed team built around mission-driven, high-ownership work in public safety. The founders are experienced engineers from Palantir and defense backgrounds who care deeply about helping government work better. The culture emphasizes thoughtful, field-driven product development with investigators and prosecutors, rapid iteration on real-world problems, and a high bar for reliability and trust in how AI is applied. Engineers are expected to be hands-on with users, comfortable with ambiguity, and motivated by impact rather than big-company structure.


What you can expect

Day to Day

You’ll spend most of your time in the field with users and turning their needs into product. In practice, that looks like:

  1. Embedding on-site with detectives, analysts, and prosecutors to watch how they investigate cases, understand their workflows, and uncover pain points.
  2. Deploying and configuring Closure’s platform for new departments, loading data, troubleshooting issues, and making sure investigators can rely on the system in day-to-day work.

  4. Owning pilots end-to-end: planning deployment, running training sessions, gathering feedback, and iterating quickly with the founding team.
  5. Traveling regularly (25–75% of your time) to customer sites across the U.S. while staying tightly looped in with the core team in New York.


Team

You’ll join a tiny, senior founding team of ex-Palantir and ex-IDF engineers who are obsessed with solving meaningful problems in public safety.

  1. You’ll report directly to Aaron Zelinger (Co-founder) and work closely with the other founders on both product and customer work.

Interview Process

  1. Initial Call (30 min) – Introductory conversation with a founder to learn more about your background, walk through the role, and assess mutual fit.
  2. Technical Deep Dive (60–75 min) – Live discussion with an engineer covering your experience building and shipping products, system-design style questions, and how you’ve handled messy real-world requirements.
  3. Practical Exercise / Case Study (60–90 min) – Short take-home or live exercise focused on how you’d approach a forward-deployed problem (e.g., understanding a customer workflow and translating it into product/technical changes).
  4. Final Round (60–90 min) – Conversations with founders and team members to go deeper on collaboration style, working with customers, mission alignment, and any remaining technical topics.


Growth

This is a founding-level role with a lot of surface area:

  1. Own critical customer deployments and relationships from day one, becoming the go-to technical partner for some of Closure’s key law-enforcement agencies.
  2. Directly influence product direction by bringing field context to every roadmap discussion and helping decide what gets built next.
  3. Help define and later scale the Forward-Deployed Engineering function — including processes, tooling, and eventually mentoring or leading additional FDEs as the team grows.
  4. Build a rare track record of high-impact, user-embedded engineering work at a YC-backed, seed-stage startup tackling complex, real-world problems.

jobsdetail.description:
Job Overview

Lead the end-to-end product experience for both admin and learner platforms, collaborating closely with engineering and product leadership. UX Design Leadership: Guide design efforts from concept to execution, including research, wireframing, prototyping, and high-fidelity design. User-Centric Research: Conduct user interviews and testing to identify friction points and validate new designs. Data-Driven Improvements: Use data and customer feedback to drive continuous product enhancements...

Responsibilities

Arist is seeking a Product Design Lead to own the end-to-end product experience across both the admin and learner platforms. You’ll collaborate closely with Maxine (Co-founder & Head of Product and Engineering) and the engineering team to design seamless workflows, conduct UX research, and ensure every feature launch meets high usability and quality standards.

This role is ideal for a designer with deep experience in SaaS products, strong product sense, and a passion for data-informed design that drives measurable impact.

  1. Lead UX design efforts from concept to execution — including research, wireframing, prototyping, and high-fidelity design.
  2. Conduct user interviews and UAT to identify friction points and validate new experiences.
  3. Create intuitive user flows and workflows that improve engagement and self-service capabilities.
  4. Use data and customer feedback to drive continuous product improvement.
  5. Partner cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success to align design goals with business objectives.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Qualifications

You’ll be stepping into a high-impact design leadership role where craft meets scale. Arist is looking for a designer who’s not only exceptional at creating beautiful, intuitive interfaces but who’s also led design for products that have grown to meaningful traction — real customers, real revenue, and measurable outcomes. The ideal candidate has shaped SaaS experiences at scale (7–8 figures in ARR), understands the nuances of building with AI, and thrives in fast-moving startup environments where design decisions directly influence company growth.

  1. 8+ years of experience in UX/UI or Product Design, ideally within high-growth SaaS environments.
  2. Proven track record leading product design for platforms generating 7–8 figures in ARR, demonstrating deep ownership from concept to launch.
  3. Strong proficiency with Figma and modern design systems.
  4. Experience designing AI-powered products or interfaces that leverage machine learning, automation, or personalization.
  5. Bonus: Background at a Y Combinator company or other venture-backed startup where speed, experimentation, and tight product loops were essential.
  6. Excellent communication skills and ability to thrive in cross-functional, founder-led environments.
  7. Data-driven mindset with sharp product intuition and a bias toward simplicity and clarity in design.


Ideal Candidate

What makes you a strong fit

  1. Owns end-to-end product experience at scale — led design for SaaS products that reached 7–8 figures ARR, translating complex workflows (admin + learner) into intuitive flows and measurable outcomes (usability, NPS, self-serve rates).
  2. AI & data-literate — comfortable designing AI-powered experiences (automation, personalization, assistants, RAG-like flows) and using product analytics/UAT to prioritize work.
  3. Design systems + speed — builds/maintains robust design systems in Figma, ships quickly with engineers, and raises quality through clear specs, reviews, and UAT.
  4. Startup-ready leadership — collaborates tightly with founders/Eng/Product/CS, can interview customers, run discovery, and make crisp, business-aware trade-offs. YC or similar venture-backed experience is a plus.


Benchmark profile (from founders)

  1. Senior/Staff Product Designer (or Design Lead) from a YC or high-growth SaaS company (e.g., Retool, Vanta, Scale AI, Linear, Segment) who has: owned a core surface, shipped roadmap with clear metrics, and stood up/leveled a design system.


Signals we’re likely to pass

  1. Portfolio is mostly visual polish with little evidence of shipped, user-validated impact (no metrics, no before/after).
  2. No enterprise/ops workflow depth (only marketing sites or B2C surface work).
  3. Can’t work US hours or needs future visa sponsorship.
  4. Limited collaboration stories with Eng/PM or weak rationale behind decisions.


Why this is exciting

  1. Direct line to founders, shaping a mission product used by global enterprises.
  2. Chance to define the admin + learner experience and the design system that powers it.
  3. Your work moves business metrics (self-serve, satisfaction, adoption) and learning outcomes—fast feedback loops, fast shipping.


Inspiration portfolios (do not contact — for calibration only)

These public portfolios show narrative quality, shipped impact, and senior craft. Useful for bar-setting when reviewing candidates:

  1. https://www.linkedin.com/in/sethweisfeld/— Senior Staff Product Designer (Meta); strong storytelling across complex surfaces and new mediums (GenAI, video).
  2. https://www.benprudden.co.uk/ — Senior Product Designer (healthtech + fintech); clear outcomes and large-scale patient experiences.
  3. https://malugin.me/resume — Senior Product Designer (Resume.io/Career.io); design systems + data-driven improvements at significant consumer scale.


Note: These are public examples to calibrate the bar/style of case studies (impact, metrics, rationale). I can also assemble a shortlist focused on US-based, SaaS, YC-adjacent designers if you want direct outreach targets (e.g., Senior/Staff from Retool, Vanta, Ramp, Mercury, Notion, Linear).

About the Company

Company Overview

Company Size:,30

Industry:AI-enabled microlearning, enterprise Learning & Development (L&D), and edtech

Founded: 2019

Headquarters: New York, New York

Total Funding: $16 million

https://www.arist.co/


Our Mission

Arist’s mission began with a simple yet radical idea: deliver entrepreneurship education to high school students in the Yemeni conflict zone using text messages—because almost no one had internet or laptops, but nearly everyone had access to SMS. From that origin, Arist has evolved into a full-stack, AI-powered enablement platform designed to help enterprises deliver microlearning, training, nudges, surveys, and communications directly in the flow of work—through SMS, Slack, Microsoft Teams, WhatsApp, email, and more. This “push-based” model bypasses traditional LMSs and meets employees where attention already lives. Arist’s strategic vision is ambitious: to become the essential push layer of enterprise enablement—bridging the gap between intent and action, powered by AI agents that handle need analysis, content creation, delivery, and analytics across global teams.

Company Culture

Arist’s culture is deeply rooted in mission-driven innovation and pragmatic impact. The company is built around the belief that learning should be frictionless and embedded within everyday workflows—reflecting a nimble, outcome-oriented mindset. The team prioritizes asynchronous, thoughtful communication (memo-driven), rapid iteration aided by AI, and high standards of enterprise reliability. This culture is shaped less by buzzwords and more by their collective focus on solving real, measurable business problems.


What you can expect

Day to Day

You’ll spend your days designing and refining user experiences across Arist’s admin and learner platforms — from initial research to polished UI. You’ll work closely with Maxine (Co-founder & Head of Product and Engineering) and the engineering team to translate insights into intuitive workflows and scalable systems. Most days involve a mix of user interviews, wireframing, design reviews, and close collaboration with engineers to ensure high-quality execution. Expect fast feedback loops, tight iteration cycles, and the ability to see your work ship quickly to enterprise customers.

Team

You’ll join a lean, highly technical founding team, reporting directly to the CTO and collaborating closely with the CEO and product leads. The team is composed of engineers with backgrounds in AI/ML, backend systems, and enterprise software, all focused on building production-grade AI enablement tools. You’ll have significant ownership and autonomy, with the ability to shape architecture, standards, and culture.

Growth

This is a senior, high-impact role with room to grow into design leadership as Arist scales. You’ll have the chance to:

  1. Shape the design direction for a product used by global enterprise customers.
  2. Influence the company’s product roadmap through user insights and data-driven design.
  3. Establish scalable design systems and workflows across teams.
  4. Build a strong track record of end-to-end ownership — positioning yourself for future leadership roles in Product or Design as Arist expands.


Interview Process

  1. Initial Call (30 min) – Introductory conversation with a recruiter or founder to discuss background, design philosophy, and motivation for joining Arist.
  2. Portfolio Deep Dive (60–75 min) – In-depth session with the Co-founder & Head of Product/Engineering reviewing past design work, decision-making process, and approach to solving UX challenges.
  3. Design Exercise / Case Study (2–3 hrs async) – Short take-home project focused on improving or conceptualizing a product flow related to Arist’s platform, followed by a walkthrough discussion.
  4. Final Round (60 min) – Cultural and cross-functional interview with founders and team members to assess collaboration style, communication, and alignment with Arist’s mission.

jobsdetail.description:
Description

Your Moonshot


Moonshot is the “Robinhood for DeFi”—an iOS and Android app that lets anyone trade cryptocurrencies on-chain through a user-friendly interface. Since our launch in July 2024, we’ve attracted 2+ million users. At Moonshot, our mission is straightforward yet ambitious: to onboard the world to decentralised finance. We believe in the power of crypto and blockchain technology to build a future where finance is open and accessible to everyone.


We’re a lean team of passionate self-starters who relish the responsibility that comes with autonomy. Everyone on our team is both a decision-maker and an implementer—united by a sense of urgency and driven by the conviction that our work can transform global finance. If you thrive on curiosity, welcome tough challenges, and aspire to leave a meaningful mark on the world, Moonshot is the place for you. You’ll run toward the hardest problems alongside high-caliber teammates who consistently push each other to excel and who share your dedication to shaping the future of decentralised finance.


The Opportunity


As a Lifecycle / Retention Manager (Braze) at Moonshot, you’ll own Braze end-to-end: email, push, in-app messaging, segmentation, journeys, and reactivation. Experience in sports betting, crypto, consumer apps, or trading environments is a strong plus.


Responsibilities:


Own all lifecycle messaging in Braze (email, push, in-app, inbox)

Build and maintain automated onboarding, retention, and win-back flows

Create dynamic segmentation and triggered journeys

Set up and monitor promotions and targeted incentives

Run A/B tests and weekly lifecycle experiments

Track activation → retention → reactivation KPIs and report learnings

Experience moving metrics, not just sending messages

Strong short-form copy instincts (mobile-first)

Comfort using data to inform decisions


Nice to Haves

Crypto / trading / sportsbook / DFS experience

Understanding of trader psychology, incentives, and habit loops


Location

NYC preferred (will have to travel for in-person sprints)

Remote US

Description

Your Moonshot

Moonshot is the “Robinhood for DeFi”—an iOS and Android app that lets anyone trade cryptocurrencies on-chain through a user-friendly interface. Since our launch in July 2024, we’ve attracted 1.5+ million users.


At Moonshot, our mission is straightforward yet ambitious: to onboard the world to decentralized finance. We believe in the power of crypto and blockchain technology to build a future where finance is open and accessible to everyone.


We’re a lean team of passionate self-starters who relish the responsibility that comes with autonomy. Everyone on our team is both a decision-maker and an implementer—united by a sense of urgency and driven by the conviction that our work can transform global finance.


If you thrive on curiosity, welcome tough challenges, and aspire to leave a meaningful mark on the world, Moonshot is the place for you. You’ll run toward the hardest problems alongside high-caliber teammates who consistently push each other to excel and who share your dedication to shaping the future of decentralised finance.


The Opportunity

As our Founding Engineer, you’ll assume a hands-on role in designing, building, and maintaining the production features that power our rapidly growing DeFi trading platform. You’ll be responsible for optimising developer velocity, ensuring platform reliability, and fostering a security-first culture.


If you’re excited by the challenge of building beautiful products for millions of users in a cutting-edge Web3 ecosystem—we want to hear from you.


What You’ll Be Doing

Product Ownership

Design, build, and ship delightful, high-impact features end-to-end across mobile and backend—shaping the core user experience of the Moonshot app.

Rapid Iteration

Collaborate closely with design, product, and growth teams to prototype, test, and launch new ideas quickly—shipping often and learning fast.

User-Centric Development

Dive deep into user feedback and product analytics to inform decisions, prioritize enhancements, and continuously improve usability and performance.

Cross-Platform Engineering

Own full-stack features from Flutter frontends to Go backends, with an emphasis on clean architecture and high performance across iOS and Android.

Quality & Reliability

Uphold engineering best practices, write high-quality code with strong test coverage, and participate in code reviews to maintain velocity without sacrificing stability.

Team Collaboration

Partner with engineers, designers, and founders to make product decisions, set milestones, and shape Moonshot’s technical direction.

Experience

2–4+ years in Product Engineer or Design roles (preferably at high-growth mobile apps or in Web3/crypto).

Product Sense

Problem-Solving Mindset

You design and develop end-to-end features that are robust, scalable, and cost-effective.

Passion for DeFi

Strong interest or experience in crypto/blockchain. You’re excited to bring on-chain products to the masses.


Nice to Haves

2–4 years of experience working on consumer mobile apps, preferably financial apps.

Previous experience at a company during a rapid growth phase (e.g., startup to mid-size).

Hands-on experience with blockchain technologies (e.g., Bitcoin, Solana, Ethereum, etc.).

Expertise in designing and implementing robust security architectures and protocols.


Tech Stack

Frontend: Flutter (iOS + Android)

Backend: Go, Postgres, Redis

Infrastructure: Kubernetes, Google Cloud, Docker, Terraform

On-Chain: Solana (with plans to explore Base, L2s, and additional blockchains)

jobsdetail.description:
Comment (20.01.2026)

Reya would still like to see profiles for this role - they want to see profiles that have solid trading and Web3 experience. This is a hard requirement for them

----------

As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you will be driving the development of a performant, responsive, real-time frontend application that powers the Reya DeX and Network. In this role, you will work closely with the team to create a seamless user experience that meets the demands of a fast-paced and data-intensive environment.


We're a dynamic, forward-thinking, fully remote team with an ambitious roadmap and a relentless drive to make things happen.


The ideal candidate is someone who loves DeFi, web3, engineering, security, rigor and speed. If you're a highly skilled Senior Frontend engineer with over eight years of experience and a commitment to code quality and state-of-the-art software testing practices, we want to hear from you.


Responsibilities


Real-Time Interface Development: Design and implement dynamic, interactive user interfaces that can handle real-time data feeds, such as live order book updates, price updates, trade executions. Your work will directly impact the user experience for traders.


Collaboration & Cross-Functional Leadership: Partner with the product team and UX/UI designer to translate complex requirements into engaging, intuitive interfaces. Work side-by-side with backend engineers to ensure smooth data flow and API integration.


Performance Optimization: Optimize application performance through efficient code, advanced rendering techniques, and smart resource management. You will focus on minimizing load times and ensuring smooth, lag-free interactions even under heavy data loads.


Responsive Design: Build responsive and accessible frontends that perform consistently across different devices and browsers, ensuring a high-quality user experience on desktops, tablets, and mobile devices.


Modern Frontend Architecture: Utilize modern frontend frameworks (such as React) and state management libraries to architect scalable and maintainable codebases. Embrace best practices in component design, testing, and documentation.

jobsdetail.description:
Comment 20.01.2026

Reya would still like to see profiles for this role - they want to see profiles that have solid trading and Web3 experience. This is a hard requirement for them


Recruiting Tips

They're looking for someone who can quickly get up to speed, take ownership, and execute effectively with minimal oversight.

Ideally, this person has deep experience in crypto - particularly with trading platforms and understands the nuances of decentralized exchanges and liquidity systems.

Currently, they operate perpetual markets on the Reya Network to provide liquidity. The next phase of their journey is to build a roll-up–based infrastructure on Ethereum, designed specifically for internet scale capital markets. Their goal is to address many of the structural inefficiencies of traditional finance by leveraging crypto.

This means building a system with sub-millisecond block times, near-zero trading fees, and seamless integration with Ethereum - bringing real-world assets and institutional-grade capital markets fully on-chain.


Senior DevOps Engineer – Reya Labs

As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining the infrastructure that powers the Reya DeX and Network. Your mission is to ensure our systems are secure, scalable, and highly available — enabling the team to deliver quickly without sacrificing reliability.

We're a dynamic, forward-thinking, fully remote team with an ambitious roadmap and a relentles drive to make things happen.

The ideal candidate is someone who loves automation, reliability engineering, infrastructure design, security, and performance. If you're a highly skilled DevOps engineer with over eight years of experience in infrastructure and CI/CD systems — and a commitment to security, observability, and operational excellence — we want to hear from you.


Responsibilities

Infrastructure Design & Automation:

Design, implement, and maintain cloud-native infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC). Build scalable, reproducible environments that support high-throughput, low-latency trading systems.

CI/CD & Developer Experience:

Own and improve the CI/CD pipelines for backend, frontend, and smart contract codebases. Ensure fast, reliable builds and deployments with strong observability and rollback mechanism.

Monitoring, Observability & Reliability:

Define and implement monitoring, logging, and alerting strategies to achieve maximum system reliability and early incident detection. Drive SLO/SLI/SLAs and participate in on-call rotations.

Scalability & Performance:

Optimize infrastructure for latency-sensitive workloads. Tune autoscaling policies, network configurations, and resource utilization to ensure consistent performance during peak loads.

Security & Compliance:

Implement robust security practices across infrastructure, CI/CD, and runtime environments. Protect systems from evolving threats through network segmentation, secret management, and runtime hardening.

Incident Response & Disaster Recovery:

Establish and maintain playbooks, failover mechanisms, and disaster recovery plans. Lead post-incident reviews and proactively address root causes.

Cost Management:

Continuously monitor and optimize cloud costs while ensuring performance and redundancy requirements are met.

Technological Evaluation:

Stay current on infrastructure tooling, orchestration frameworks, and security best practices. Evaluate new technologies for potential adoption to improve performance and resilience.

Documentation & Knowledge Sharing:

Maintain clear, detailed documentation for infrastructure, processes, and runbooks. Mentor engineers and help foster a culture of reliability and automation across the team.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Minimum Qualifications

8+ years of experience in DevOps, SRE, or infrastructure engineering roles in high-availability, mission-critical systems

6+ years of experience with major cloud platforms (AWS and GCP)

Strong proficiency with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Pulumi, or CloudFormation)

Expertise with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes)

Experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, ArgoCD, etc.)

Advanced knowledge of monitoring, logging, and alerting tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK/EFK, OpenTelemetry)

Hands-on experience with secrets management and security best practices (HashiCorp Vault, KMS, IAM policies)

Proven ability to manage and tune production infrastructure supporting latency-sensitive workloads

Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash, Go, or similar)

Excellent communication and collaboration skills with a focus on reliability and continuous improvement


Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience

jobsdetail.description:
New comment (20/01/2026)

Reya would still like to see profiles for this role - they want to see profiles that have solid trading and Web3 experience. This is a hard requirement for them

Description

As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing and maintaining robust and scalable backend systems. Your role goes beyond writing code—you’ll architect systems that are resilient, secure, and optimized for low-latency, real-time processing.

We're a dynamic, forward-thinking, fully remote team with an ambitious roadmap and a relentless drive to make things happen.

The ideal candidate is someone who loves DeFi, web3, engineering, security, rigor and speed. If you're a highly skilled Senior Backend engineer with over eight years of experience with a commitment to code quality and state-of-the-art software testing practices, we want to hear from you.

Responsibilities

Backend Development: Design, develop, and maintain the core backend systems that power the Reya DeX and Network. This includes writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code. The exchange backend will need to support a high-throughput order-book and index on-chain data into event queues and various persistence layers to be consumed by the UI and Risk Dashboards via scalable APIs and WebSockets.

System Architecture: Define the high-level structure of the backend systems, the data flow, and interactions between the various components of the backend stack. Focus on messaging and event-driven architecture patterns common in financial services.

Reliability, Performance & Availability: Ensure the architectural design addresses reliability and high availability and performance requirements. Implement failover mechanisms, redundancy, and disaster recovery plans to minimize downtime.

Security: Implement and maintain robust security measures to protect backend systems and APIs from a variety of attack patterns including but not limited to DDoS attacks, data breaches, injection attacks.

Data Storage Strategy: Define the strategy for data storage, including selection of databases and data models suitable for financial applications. Consider trade-offs between relational, key-value stores and messaging queues.

Testing Strategy: Develop and execute a comprehensive testing strategy including unit, integration, security, load and performance testing. Collaborate with the development team to create and maintain detailed test reports and testing processes.

Technological Evaluation: Stay updated on emerging technologies and trends in backend development and architecture. Evaluate the potential adoption of new tools, frameworks, and methodologies to enhance our systems' performance and scalability.

Documentation and Communication: Clearly document the architectural design, making it accessible to the development team and non-technical audience. Collaborate with software engineers to implement the design effectively and ensure that it aligns with the intended goals.

Code Review: Participate in code reviews, mentor junior engineers, and enforce coding standards and best practices.

Team Collaboration: Work closely with the cross-functional team, including on-chain and front end engineers as well as the heads of product management and quant, cto and ceo.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Minimum Qualifications

8+ years of experience as a Backend Engineer with experience working in financial services industry

6+ years of experience with Rust and/or C++ building highly scalable webservices

Mastery of asynchronous programming and advanced concurrency patterns. Emphasis on thread safety and lock-free data structures.

6+ years of experience designing and maintaining relational databases like PosgreSQL

4+ years of experience with messaging and low latency persistence like Kafka, Redis, RabbitMQ or others

Experience in building and maintaining high-availability systems that have handled significant transaction volumes

Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment

Strong proficiency in securing and hardening backend systems and APIs against evolving security threats.

Strong knowledge of software testing methodologies

Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g Docker, Kubernetes)

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent experience

Experience with low-level network programming, including asynchronous I/O, direct socket programming, and familiarity with Linux kernel optimizations (e.g., epoll, zero-copy, or even kernel bypass techniques where applicable)

Experience in fine-tuning latency-sensitive components, particularly in trading systems like order matching engines and risk engines

Familiarity with blockchain technology, smart contracts and decentralized systems

Knowledge and understanding of fundamentals of finance, more specifically derivatives trading

jobsdetail.description:
Predicate are currently in the middle of a tight product launch for the next two weeks. I will push to get feedback on the profiles shared, but it is unlikely we will hear back before then. The interviews that have been booked will still be going ahead as planned.


Please let candidates know, to manage their expectations of timescales.


Updated the JD and hiring criteria. This role is now a major focus for Predicate, we have just placed 2 people there.

They would be interested in anyone from an L1/ L2 that understands blockchains, blockchain providers or RPC's


Unlock the next era of public blockchain networks

About us

We’re building Predicate, a platform setting the standard for how regulated blockchain applications enforce transaction rules at the smart contract layer. Predicate empowers teams to create modular, programmable policies—such as AML/CFT checks or offchain collateral requirements—that are verified before a transaction executes onchain. Our system enforces these policies with cryptographic guarantees, providing robust, scalable risk management tailored to real-world use cases.

The role

As Protocol Lead, you’ll own the design, development, and maintenance of Predicate’s onchain suite. You’ll build tooling to support integrations, contribute to core infrastructure, and research emerging technologies to keep us at the forefront of the industry. You’ll also serve as the team’s blockchain subject matter expert, supporting teammates across the stack on all things related to blockchain interactions.

Responsibilities

  1. Own the architecture, development, and maintenance of Predicate’s core smart contracts
  2. Support customers integrating Predicate at the smart contract level
  3. Deeply understand and add Predicate support for non-EVM chains
  4. Iterate on the Predicate SDK and relevant documentation to supply a strong integration experience
  5. Collaborate with the rest of the engineering team in Go and TypeScript on blockchain facing technology

jobsdetail.description:
Comment: More than 5 hires here so please send candidates. Good company backgrounds and decent tenures. Will consider people with 2+ years exp!

Important: Please read the following before referring candidates

They have a high bar on the role, good education and well-known companies that people have worked at is usually a good signal for them. If you are sending candidates from outside of North America please make sure they have good tenures at reputable companies.

Description

About the Company

Rain makes the next generation of payments possible across the globe. We’re a lean and mighty team of passionate builders and veteran founders. Our infrastructure makes stablecoins usable in the real-world by powering card transactions, cross-border payments, B2B purchases, remittances, and more. We partner with fintechs, neobanks, and institutions to help them launch solutions that are global, inclusive, and efficient. You will have the opportunity to deliver massive impact at a hypergrowth company that is funded by some of the top investors in fintech, crypto, and SaaS, including Sapphire Ventures, Norwest, Galaxy Ventures, Lightspeed, Khosla, and several more. If you’re curious, bold, and excited to help shape a borderless financial future, we’d love to talk.

Our Ethos

We believe in an open and flat structure. You will be able to grow into the role that most aligns with your goals. Our team members at all levels have the freedom to explore ideas and impact the roadmap and vision of our company.

What you'll do

Be a critical part of the technical and product roadmap

Contribute to our backend and blockchain infrastructure

Interact with smart contracts across multiple chains

Drive the development on new smart contracts and support new chains

Scale our on-chain infrastructure to millions of end users globally

Rapidly ship new capabilities to our customers

Help drive the architectural decisions of a rapidly evolving product
jobsdetail.requirement:
What we're looking for

Experience with NodeJs and other backend technologies

Experience with interacting with smart contracts and blockchains

This position is for folks with 2-10+ years experience, compensation will be based on experience

Nice to haves, but not mandatory

Fintech experience (neobank or card issuing experience gets extra brownie points)
jobsdetail.benefits:
Compensation & Package

Things that enable a fulfilling, healthy and happy experience at Rain:

Unlimited time off 🌴Unlimited vacation can be daunting, so we require Rainmakers to take 10 days minimum for themselves.

Flexible working ☕ We support a flexible workplace, if you feel comfortable at home please work from home. If you’d like to work with others in an office feel free to come in. We want everyone to be able to work in the environment in which they are their most confident and productive selves. New Rainmakers will have a stipend to create a comfortable atmosphere at home.

Easy to access benefits 🧠For US Rainmakers, we offer comprehensive health, dental and vision plans for you and your dependents, as well as a 100% company subsidized life insurance plan.

Retirement goals💡Plan for the future with confidence. We offer a 401(k) with a 4% company match.

Equity plan 📦 We offer every Rainmakers an equity option plan so we can all can benefit from our success.

Rain Cards 🌧️ We want Rainmakers to be knowledgeable about our core products and services. To support this mission, we issue a card for our team to utilize the card for testing.

Health and Wellness 📚 High performance begins from within. Rainmakers are welcome to use their card for eligible health and wellness spending like gym memberships/fitness classes, massages, acupuncture - whatever recharges you!

Team summits ✨ Summits play an important role at Rain! Time spent together helps us get to know each other, strengthen our relationships, and build a common destiny. Expect team and company offsites both domestically and internationally.

Interview Process

1.Recruiter / HR Call

Phone screen with the CTO

Looking at team fit, culture etc

2.Technical Interview

This will be diving deeper into past projects, impact they made etc.

3.Technical Assignment

2 hour session with the team. Half is architecture based and the other programming based.

4.Founder / CEO Interview

Last wrap-up call

About Rain

Rain has built a vertically integrated issuing stack focused on global services. Rain services platforms, banks, institutional custodians and everything in between. Our mission? To provide our partners with seamless access to products to service their global client base.

jobsdetail.description:
Important: Please read the following before referring candidates

They have a high bar on the role, good education and well-known companies that people have worked at is usually a good signal for them. If you are sending candidates from outside of North America please make sure they have good tenures at reputable companies.


Description

About Rain

At Rain, we’re rebuilding the global financial pipes money flows through. Our infrastructure makes stablecoins usable in the real world by powering credit card transactions, cross-border payments, B2B purchases, remittances, and more. We partner with fintechs, neobanks, and institutions to help them launch solutions that are global, inclusive, and efficient. If you’re curious, bold, and excited to help shape a borderless financial system, we’d love to talk.

Our Ethos

Operating at the epicenter of stablecoin innovation means moving fast and thinking globally. Our team reflects the diverse, international audiences we serve. We hire people who stay agile as the tide ebbs and flows, fix what’s broken without waiting, chase trends before they peak, and remember to have fun through it all.


About the Role


We’re looking for Rain’s first dedicated Data Engineer—a hands-on builder who will architect the ingestion, pipelines, and infrastructure that power our data ecosystem. As Rain scales to millions of end users across payments, card programs, and blockchain rails, your systems will ensure every team has access to timely, accurate, and trustworthy data.


Reporting to the CTO and partnering closely with Analytics, Operations, Product, Compliance, and BD, you will own Rain’s data pipelines end-to-end: from ingesting raw transaction and blockchain data, to orchestrating transformations, to ensuring quality, observability, and reliability. This role is foundational—you’ll be shaping the data backbone that underpins analytics, customer reporting, operational tooling, and on-chain integrations.


If you love building in fast-moving environments, care deeply about data quality, and want to own core infrastructure at the heart of a modern fintech, this role is for you.


What You'll Do

Design, build, and maintain Rain’s core data pipelines, including ingestion from payments processors, card issuers, blockchain nodes, internal services, and third-party APIs.

Own orchestration and workflow management, implementing Airflow, Dagster, or similar tools to ensure reliable, observable, and scalable data processing.

Architect and manage Rain’s data warehouse (Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift), driving performance, cost optimization, partitioning, and access patterns.

Develop high-quality ELT/ETL transformations to structure raw logs, transactions, ledgers, and on-chain events into clean, production-grade datasets.

Implement data quality frameworks and observability (tests, data contracts, freshness checks, lineage) to ensure every dataset is trustworthy.

Partner closely with backend engineers to instrument new events, define data contracts, and improve telemetry across Rain’s infrastructure.

Support Analytics and cross-functional teams by delivering well-modeled, well-documented tables that power dashboards, ROI analyses, customer reporting, and key business metrics.

Own data reliability at scale, leading root-cause investigations, reducing pipeline failures, and building monitoring and alerting systems.

Evaluate and integrate new tools across ingestion, enrichment, observability, and developer experience—raising the bar on performance and maintainability.

Help set the long-term technical direction for Rain’s data platform as we scale across new products, regions, and chains.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Who You Are

Data infrastructure builder – You thrive in early-stage environments, owning pipelines and platforms end-to-end and choosing simplicity without sacrificing reliability.

Expert data engineer – Strong Python and SQL fundamentals, with real experience building production-grade ETL/ELT.

Workflow & orchestration fluent – Hands-on experience with Airflow, Dagster, Prefect, or similar systems.

Warehouse & modeling savvy – Comfortable designing schemas, optimizing performance, and operating modern cloud warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).

Quality-obsessed – You care deeply about data integrity, testing, lineage, and observability.

Systems thinker – You see data as a platform; you design for reliability, scale, and future users.

Collaborator – You work well with backend engineers, analytics engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to define requirements and deliver outcomes.

Experienced – 5–7+ years in data engineering roles, ideally within fintech, payments, B2B SaaS, or infrastructure-heavy startups.


Nice to Have

Experience ingesting and processing payments data, transaction logs, or ledger systems.

Exposure to smart contracts, blockchain data structures, or on-chain event ingestion.

Experience building data tooling for compliance, risk, or regulated environments.

Familiarity with dbt and/or semantic modeling to support analytics layers.

Prior experience standing up data platforms from 0→1 at early-stage companies.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Compensation & Package

Things that enable a fulfilling, healthy and happy experience at Rain:

Unlimited time off 🌴Unlimited vacation can be daunting, so we require Rainmakers to take 10 days minimum for themselves.

Flexible working ☕ We support a flexible workplace, if you feel comfortable at home please work from home. If you’d like to work with others in an office feel free to come in. We want everyone to be able to work in the environment in which they are their most confident and productive selves. New Rainmakers will have a stipend to create a comfortable atmosphere at home.

Easy to access benefits 🧠For US Rainmakers, we offer comprehensive health, dental and vision plans for you and your dependents, as well as a 100% company subsidized life insurance plan.

Retirement goals💡Plan for the future with confidence. We offer a 401(k) with a 4% company match.

Equity plan 📦 We offer every Rainmakers an equity option plan so we can all can benefit from our success.

Rain Cards 🌧️ We want Rainmakers to be knowledgeable about our core products and services. To support this mission, we issue a card for our team to utilize the card for testing.

Health and Wellness 📚 High performance begins from within. Rainmakers are welcome to use their card for eligible health and wellness spending like gym memberships/fitness classes, massages, acupuncture - whatever recharges you!

Team summits ✨ Summits play an important role at Rain! Time spent together helps us get to know each other, strengthen our relationships, and build a common destiny. Expect team and company offsites both domestically and internationally.

Looking at team fit, culture etc

This will be diving deeper into past projects, impact they made etc.

2 hour session with the team. Half is architecture based and the other programming based.

4.Founder / CEO Interview

Last wrap-up call

Will take a look at LLM (Rust/C++) heavy backend profiles, who have strong trading, wallets or tokens experience!

Description

About Senpi:

Senpi is building autonomous trading.

Backed by $4.5M in recent funding from Lemniscap and Coinbase Ventures, Senpi’s vision is bold and concrete: to become the “Waymo of onchain trading” — fully autonomous trading agents that help users navigate, outperform, and ultimately beat the markets.

Senpi is building the infrastructure and intelligence layer that makes that future possible.

Senpi co-founders Jason Goldberg, Sarvesh Jain, and Ignas Peciura have been innovating together on Ethereum since 2017 and at the edge of blockchain x AI since 2022. This is an opportunity to join a crack team that’s aggressively pioneering the future of trading.

What You’ll Be Building:

Real-time, budget-aware mirror trading infrastructure on Hyperliquid and beyond

High-throughput wallet and trading systems operating under extreme volatility

AI-driven intelligence layers that continuously improve trading outcomes

Production systems designed for correctness, resilience, and speed

Developer workflows where AI is used aggressively as a force multiplier

This is frontier-level work across perps infrastructure, crypto wallets, trading systems, and applied AI.

jobsdetail.requirement:
Role Overview

▪ Job Title: (Senior) Integration Specialist

▪ Department / Team: Technical Services / Customer Success Engineering

▪ Reason for Hiring: Backfill – previous employee exited due to poor performance and churned key accounts

▪ No. of Vacancies: 1


🌍 Location & Working Model

▪ Primary Location: Munich, Germany

▪ Remote / Hybrid / On-Site Policy: Hybrid or full on-site in Munich


🎯 Key Responsibilities

▪ Own end-to-end technical onboarding and integration for new customers, acting as primary contact and coordinator

▪ Execute web, shop, and CRM data integrations (JavaScript tagging, API / webhook setup, SQL checks)

▪ Provide 2nd-level technical support: issue reproduction, raw event analysis, troubleshooting before escalation to engineering

▪ Prepare solution concepts and feasibility assessments for custom client requests, incl. pricing input

▪ Liaise closely with Product, Sales, and Engineering to ensure seamless delivery and continuous improvement

▪ Transfer learnings across clients to optimise future implementations

▪ Maintain clear customer communication, documentation, and follow-ups throughout the integration lifecycle


✅ Ideal Candidate Profile

Must-Haves:

▪ Native German + English C1

▪ Strong JavaScript skills for tagging/event tracking

▪ Hands-on experience with website or shop integrations and analytics tools (e.g., Mixpanel, Adobe, GA)

▪ Proven work with APIs, webhooks, SQL, HTTP/cookies, event-driven analytics

▪ Track record of customer-facing technical onboarding or solution architecture

▪ Methodical, detail-oriented, able to transfer knowledge to new cases


Nice-to-Haves:

▪ Startup or fast-growth company background

▪ Python or other scripting for automation

▪ CRM system administration experience


❌ Dealbreakers / Red Flags:

▪ Low technical depth

▪ Frequent job changes

▪ No experience collaborating with engineering teams

▪ Unstructured or “feeler” personality types; lack of thoroughness

▪ Limited customer interaction history

Personality Traits:

▪ Preferred MBTI: INTJ, INTP, ISTJ (logical, systematic, self-directed)

▪ High sales empathy, customer centric, proactive problem solver


💚 Green Flags:

▪ Experience with website and/or shop integrations

▪ Heavy skilled in own Knowledge Transfer: Bestehendes Wissen auf neue Cases Transferieren (e.g. “hat bei dem Kunden so geklappt, könnten wir abgewandelt für siesen Kunden auch nutzen”)

▪ Experience with CRM Systems and data-driven environments: Weiß wie ein CRM funktioniert und worauf es in der Admin ankommt und hat ein Verständnis für die Relevanz von datengetriebenes Arbeiten

▪ Experience in a fast moving environment: Former companies and/or projects “startup-like”

▪ Experience in working with Engineering teams / technical background

▪ Experience with Tracking; BI and/or Performance Marketing

▪ Familiarity with analytics tools and data collection methods

▪ Strong understanding of JavaScript, especially for tagging and event tracking

▪ Ability to troubleshoot technical integration issues

▪ Experience with APIs, webhooks, and basic backend concepts

▪ SQL Skills: need to understand how to write database queries

▪ Knowledge of HTTP, cookies, and browser behavior

▪ Experience with Event-driven analytics systems

▪ Basic Scripting (e.g. Python)


🎓 Experience & Education

▪ Experience: Integration/implementation engineering, tracking analytics, solution architecture within analytics vendors or agencies

▪ Education: Degree in IT, Computer Science, or related field (beneficial)

▪ Specific Tools/Technologies: JavaScript, REST APIs, SQL, webhooks, HTTP, cookies, event-driven analytics platforms, CRM systems, basic Python
jobsdetail.benefits:
Compensation

▪ Base Salary Range: €55,000 – €70,000 gross p.a.


📄 Contract Details

▪ Contract Type: Permanent, full-time (Festanstellung, Vollzeit)

▪ Probation period: 6 months

▪ Vacation: 24 days


🎁 Perks

▪ Flat hierarchies & fast decision cycles

▪ Technically challenging, performance-focused environment

▪ Culture of continuous learning & modern tech adoption


🧭 Sourcing Guidance (Recruiter Enablement)

▪ Target Industries / Companies (Whitelist): Web analytics vendors (Mixpanel, Adobe, Google Analytics, Contentsquare, Piwik PRO); tracking/attribution SaaS; analytics implementation agencies; MarTech consultancies

▪ Avoided Companies / Backgrounds (Blacklist): Non-technical roles, pure marketing with no integration exposure, job-hoppers

▪ Relevant Job Titles: Integration Specialist, Implementation Engineer, Technical Consultant, Solution Architect, Tracking Engineer, Customer Success Engineer, Technical Onboarding Manager

▪ Boolean Search Suggestion: ("Integration Specialist" OR "Implementation Engineer" OR "Solution Architect" OR "Tracking Consultant") AND (JavaScript OR "event tracking") AND (API OR webhook) AND (German) AND (Munich OR Bayern)

▪ Pitch Ideas for Candidate Outreach: Emphasise high ownership of client integrations, hybrid work in Munich, exposure to cutting-edge event-driven analytics, clear career impact on customer success, and a culture that values logical thinkers and technical depth


📈 KPIs & Success Metrics

▪ Successful integrations completed on time

▪ Reduction in technical onboarding duration

▪ Customer satisfaction / NPS post-integration

▪ Decrease in 2nd-level support escalations

▪ Retention of key accounts post-go-live


🔎 Hiring Process

▪ Step 1 – 10-min scheduling / pre-screen call with MSC

▪ Step 2 – Screening & first interview with Moritz (recommendation) → Slack decision by Adam/Dennis

▪ Step 3 – Leader Call with Dennis (customer-related fit and Tracify pitch)

▪ Step 4 – Specialist Call with Adam (deep technical assessment)

▪ Step 5 – Informal dinner with Dennis, Marius, Adam/Moritz
jobsdetail.other:
⚡ Quick Start for Experienced Recruiters

1) Review the must-haves and sourcing guidance thoroughly – be selective from the start.

2) Prioritize outreach to profiles with the highest match potential, even if they are passive.

3) Leverage niche networks and competitor talent pools before going broad.

4) Use the pitch ideas to create a compelling, personalized opening message – avoid generic outreach.

5) Aim to submit your top 2–3 strongest profiles early, to set the tone with quality.

6) Keep juucy updated on market feedback, objections, and talent availability trends.


Extra Recruiting Requirement – Special Requirement

According to the MBTI personality test, candidates must have one of the following personality types to be considered for this role:

▪ Architect (INTJ)

▪ Logician (INTP)

▪ Logistician (ISTJ)

➡️ Please share the MBTI test with your candidates and include the test results in the Briefing Notes.

Test link: https://www.16personalities.com/de/kostenloser-personlichkeitstest

🚨 IMPORTANT: Please do NOT disclose to candidates which personality types Tracify is specifically looking for.

Description

We're seeking a motivated Junior Data Analyst who’s eager to learn, grow, and make an impact in a fast-paced environment. In this role, you'll support data initiatives across our product, helping teams make informed decisions through clear analysis, reporting, and insight generation. You’ll work closely with more senior data staff while gradually taking on more ownership as you develop.


What You’ll Do

Assist in designing, running, and analyzing A/B tests to help improve our consumer product experience

Investigate product metrics to uncover trends, issues, and opportunities

Build, update, and maintain dashboards to track KPIs and present insights

jobsdetail.description:
Description

Who we're looking for:

We are looking for a creative back-end focused engineer to help us architect, build, and maintain our increasingly dynamic web creative tooling experiences for TITLES. You are a driven developer who enjoys critically thinking about the best ways to build a new product, take full ownership in creating a brand new extensible codebase, and bring fresh new ideas to the TITLES experience. You’ll build and own core platform services, design scalable APIs, shape our data infrastructure, and contribute across the stack when needed. You’re an endless experimenter with a focus on AI coding tools, agents, and automation to amplify engineering velocity. Finally and most importantly, you love collaborating with a team of talented domain experts and relish startup pace, ambiguity, and iterating through problems.


What you'll do:

Build and maintain core backend services, APIs, and data layers that power the TITLES experience.

Partner with product, design, and data to define and deliver features end-to-end.

Design scalable, secure, and observable systems capable of supporting rapid user growth.

Contribute across the stack, including frontend applications (e.g. React) with a focus on user experience.

Drive CI/CD, infrastructure automation, and developer tooling to improve engineering velocity.

Leverage and experiment with AI-assisted coding tools, agents, and workflows to accelerate delivery, quality, and testing.

Help evolve our architecture with strong opinions on modular design, APIs, and service boundaries.

jobsdetail.description:
Description

LI.FI is simplifying multi-chain DeFi for traditional financial institutions, fintechs and service providers by offering a unified API to access all on-chain liquidity across major blockchains for best price same-chain and cross-chain swaps. We are a passionate team on a mission to enable a fairer, more decentralised world. Apart from the tech, we care a lot about user experience and aim to make complex technologies accessible to everyone.


A quick run-down of the job


Join LI.FI as a Backend Developer with a dedicated focus on integrating Hyperliquid functionalities into our API platform. This role is backend-only—no frontend or design work required—letting you shape core integrations at the infrastructure layer. The ideal candidate is excited about Hyperliquid and its protocols, eager to help us distribute programmatic trading features (e.g., TWAP, perps) to the broader DeFi ecosystem through performant backend systems.


Please note: You must be located in the EMEA region. Your application will not be considered otherwise.


What you'll do

Extend LI.FI’s API stack to include Hyperliquid ecosystem projects and feature set

Collaborate closely with the Expansion PM and other backend engineers to improve integrations, routing, and user flows; help evaluate new opportunities for feature extension.

Ensure robust, high-quality backend code, focusing on scalability and reliability for same-chain and cross-chain trading.

Participate in code reviews, system design, and documentation.
jobsdetail.requirement:
What makes a good candidate

Familiarity with Hyperliquid’s architecture: You understand builder codes (spot, perps), HIP-3, precompiles, and HyperEVM at a design level and keep up with evolving documentation.

Hyperliquid focus: You should be passionate about the Hyperliquid ecosystem and be able to demonstrate your familiarity with the ecosystem — past projects or self-driven exploration are valued

Orderbook fundamentals: You grasp the mechanics of orderbooks and are comfortable working with programmatic trading features

Backend focus: Solid backend engineering background, especially with EVM and integration patterns; front-end or modal design work is not expected.

TypeScript proficiency: Experience building scalable APIs and backend systems in TypeScript.

Independence: Can drive integrations and new feature proposals with minimal oversight, collaborating effectively in a remote-first team.

Cross-chain experience: Experience with bridges and backend infrastructure supporting a multi-chain environment is highly valued.

Bonus: Familiarity with Solana, Bitcoin, or mobile backend development.
jobsdetail.benefits:
How we hire

We prioritize candidates who show genuine excitement for Hyperliquid and demonstrate technical familiarity with its protocols. Expect conversations where you can showcase prior Hyperliquid-related projects and discuss ideas for future integration work. We won’t require prior Hyperliquid work experience but will test your understanding through interview discussions and portfolio review.


Company culture

Embracing the differences

Embrace your own differences

Respect and welcome the unique qualities of others

See others’ differences as an opportunity to grow

Own it, do it

Own tasks end-to-end

Hold yourself to a high bar for execution

Make bold decisions, and be accountable

Understand your limitatins and seek for help

Fail forward

Try - don’t be afraid to fail

Learn - don’t make the same mistake twice

Adapt - grow with the experience

Have fun together

Take the time to get to know and understand each other better

Don’t take yourself too seriously and keep it light-hearted

Fun should be coming from a place of love and respect


Compensation & Package

Annual team offsites (Thailand in 2023 and Vietnam in 2024 were a blast, Marrakech in March 2025 was blast-ier; let’s see what happens in 2026!)

30 days of PTO

Flexible remote days

Flexible working hours

Equity participation from day 1

Entitlement to work computer (choice of equipment)

An annual 1,000€ personal development budget once you have worked 6+ months (pro-rated the first year)

A one-time 1,000€ remote budget to use on coworking, office setup, etc.


Interview Process

1.Recruiter / HR Call

2.Hiring Manager Interview

3.Take Home Test

4.Technical Interview

5.Group Interview


About LI.FI

Berlin-based LI.FI is providing a bridge between different blockchains, enabling developers to navigate a wide range of decentralised finance (DeFi) applications across multiple chains. The platform provides an application programme interface (API) that developers can build on to create prototypes and go to market faster.


The arrival of LI.FI comes at a time when DeFi has reemerged as a trending topic in the world of crypto, after the collapse of the centralised crypto exchange FTX. The resurgence of DeFi seems to provide a far more sustainable, scalable, and transparent crypto economy.


Backed by crypto-native investment firms CoinFund and Superscrypt, LI.FI is now in a prime position to execute its long term strategy of bringing more users to the world of Web3, by enabling tokens and orders to trade across any chain seamlessly.

Company Size

11-50

Headquarters

Germany

jobsdetail.description:
The Client confirmed they will review / continue with the candidates already in process, but they will not consider new candidates at this stage.

Thank you very much for your support on this role.

Description

LI.FI is simplifying multi-chain DeFi for traditional financial institutions, fintechs and service providers by offering a unified API to access all on-chain liquidity across major blockchains for best price same-chain and cross-chain swaps. We are a passionate team on a mission to enable a fairer, more decentralised world. Apart from the tech, we care a lot about user experience and aim to make complex technologies accessible to everyone.

A quick run-down of the job

We're looking for a Senior Backend Engineer (Intents - Order Server) to lead the development and scaling of our core off-chain coordination service. This is a critical infrastructure role, as the Order Server is the central hub that manages the entire Intent lifecycle—from quote aggregation and intent validation to real-time broadcasting and cross-chain status tracking. You will be building the secure, high-throughput system using TypeScript and NestJS that allows applications to discover competitive quotes and protects our Solvers from fraudulent orders, enabling a robust and trustless cross-chain experience. This position is vital for the success of our solver-based Intents architecture.

🌍 Locaiton

Remote within the EMEA region (Europe, Middle East, Africa). Your application will not be considered if you’re outside of this region.

What you’ll do

Your core mission will be to lead the technical direction and implementation of the central off-chain coordination system for our next-generation architecture. This is a critical infrastructure role focused on security, performance, and reliability.

System Architecture & Development: Design, implement, and maintain the highly available, low-latency APIs required for seamless application interaction, quote management, and system-wide status retrieval using Node.js/TypeScript and the NestJS framework.

Security & Validation Logic: Develop advanced and rigorous validation mechanisms to ensure data integrity and prevent fraudulent activity within the system, including logic for checking digital signatures, timing constraints, and necessary co-signatures.

Real-Time Data Distribution: Build and optimize the infrastructure for immediate, real-time broadcasting of critical, validated data to all participating external liquidity providers and execution partners.

Multi-Phase Status Tracking: Integrate with specialized data indexing services to reliably monitor and track the multi-phase lifecycle of core system objects across distributed environments, ensuring users and applications receive accurate, real-time status updates.

Optimization of Execution Coordination: Implement advanced logic for data aggregation, caching, and mechanisms for partner reputation and selection to ensure the best possible user experience.

Security & System Integrity: Proactively identify and resolve potential security vulnerabilities in the off-chain coordination flow to maintain the trustless nature of the overall system.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with the core Smart Contract and Product teams, and ensure comprehensive documentation for the backend architecture and APIs.
jobsdetail.requirement:
What makes a good candidate

5+ years of backend development experience building and scaling high-throughput, mission-critical services.

Expert proficiency in TypeScript/Node.js, with deep working experience using the NestJS framework for building scalable backend applications.

Deep understanding of blockchain data and security primitives, including EIP-712 signatures, transaction execution flows, and reading on-chain events/logs.

Proven experience in designing and scaling real-time communication systems (e.g., WebSockets, Redis Pub/Sub patterns).

Solid experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL, etc.) and optimizing complex queries.

Strong system design skills, with the ability to build fault-tolerant and highly available microservices.

Experience with monitoring, logging, and observability tools to maintain system health.

Ability to work autonomously, prioritize tasks effectively, and drive complex projects to completion in a fast-paced environment.

Nice to haves

Experience integrating with or developing against blockchain indexing services (e.g., Goldsky, The Graph, Subgraphs).

Familiarity with Intent-centric architectures, Solvers, or off-chain order matching systems.

Direct experience with cross-chain message passing or oracle systems like Polymer/Wormhole.

Experience with Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform) and cloud-native deployments (Kubernetes, AWS/GCP).

About LI.FI

Berlin-based LI.FI is providing a bridge between different blockchains, enabling developers to navigate a wide range of decentralised finance (DeFi) applications across multiple chains. The platform provides an application programme interface (API) that developers can build on to create prototypes and go to market faster.

The arrival of LI.FI comes at a time when DeFi has reemerged as a trending topic in the world of crypto, after the collapse of the centralised crypto exchange FTX. The resurgence of DeFi seems to provide a far more sustainable, scalable, and transparent crypto economy.

Backed by crypto-native investment firms CoinFund and Superscrypt, LI.FI is now in a prime position to execute its long term strategy of bringing more users to the world of Web3, by enabling tokens and orders to trade across any chain seamlessly.
