jobsdetail.description:
New role live with Raiku! Candidates must be Solana native and worked on runtime, scheduler or other core systems on Solana - please ensure that the candidate githubs are active


About Raiku

Raiku is reengineering blockchain infrastructure from first principles to make global digital markets as precise and dependable as physical systems. Built on Solana, our platform delivers deterministic execution, guaranteed inclusion, and low-latency performance—solving the foundational failures that cause transactions to miss, trades to revert, and systems to collapse under pressure. By placing high-performance compute close to where transactions happen and coordinating execution through our advanced scheduling engine, Raiku empowers developers to build scalable, high-performance applications—and gives institutions the reliability and control they demand. We believe financial infrastructure should behave like physics: fast, reliable, and predictable—every time, without exception.


The Role

As a Senior Validator Engineer at Raiku, you will spearhead our engineering efforts surrounding the Solana Validator (both Agave and Firedancer), driving the innovation and implementation of next-generation high-performance distributed systems. You will work with a highly proficient team of core engineers who have all contributed to foundational and novel network components.


We believe in hiring only exceptional individuals who are highly motivated to work on complex core infrastructure challenges and are motivated by a coherent system design philosophy that will drive our industry forward. Expect frequent group discussions on architecture, new design specs and code reviews. We are all deeply committed to frequently shipping quality code.


About the Engineering Team

As a team, we are building an entire platform written in Rust, which connects the L1 and L2s and allows us to create deeply complex scenarios and interactions with the running network. While your primary focus for this role is Rust and complex interactions with different components, you may also be involved with other types of development, including exposure to the C-coded Firedancer validator. Working at every level of the stack is necessary to understand the big picture and how everything is wired together.


Responsibilities:

Highly motivated to contribute to our mission and be part of something bigger. Excited to work on projects that are ground-breaking and complex

Refactor, improve and lead software design and implementation

Communicate effectively with the team and document your code. It is also expected that senior engineers mentor less experienced engineers.

Read and understand protocol specifications and be able to break them into issues and turn them into code.

Maintaining a large codebase with many components and keeping it well-designed, future-proofed, modular and highly performant

Automate security testing processes and benchmarks, creating innovative tools and frameworks for continuously improving our systems.
jobsdetail.requirement:
What You'll Bring:

A bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field, coupled with practical experience in blockchain systems.

At least 3 years of experience in blockchain and distributed systems, with a deep technical understanding of L1 and L2 architectures. Ideally Solana.

Experience in writing efficient low-level code.

Strong proficiency in Rust, with at least 2-3 years of Rust experience.

Demonstrated experience in designing, developing, and deploying scalable distributed systems.

An analytical mindset with the ability to anticipate and mitigate emerging security threats, leveraging a comprehensive understanding of the blockchain landscape.

Direct involvement in the Solana ecosystem, with contributions to Solana's runtime, scheduler, or other core systems.


Preferred Qualifications:

Proficiency and experience in writing C code.

Active open-source contributions in core protocol engineering (such as Firedancer, Reth, Lighthouse, Geth, …).

Active engagement with the blockchain security research community, evidenced by contributions to open-source projects, publications, or presentations at notable conferences.


About Raiku

Raiku reimagines how applications interact with Solana through infrastructure products that improve scalability, reliability and performance.

Resources

Website

https://www.raiku.com/

Twitter

https://x.com/raikucom

Description

As a Senior Firmware Engineer at our organization, you will develop, design, and optimize firmware for our cutting-edge cryptocurrency hardware wallets. You will closely collaborate with hardware and software teams to deliver secure, high-quality, reliable, and efficient firmware solutions.


Responsibilities

Design, develop, and test firmware for electronic devices, including microcontrollers, embedded systems, and IoT devices.

Collaborate with other engineers, designers, and customers to understand project requirements and provide firmware solutions.

Write, test, and debug firmware code in various programming languages such as C, C++, and Python.

Develop multi-threaded applications.

Verify and validate firmware updates and upgrades.

Identify and troubleshoot firmware issues, and implement necessary changes to improve performance.

Provide technical support and guidance to production and assembly teams.

Prepare technical documentation such as firmware design documents and user manuals.

Continuously improve and optimize firmware for better performance and reliability.

Collaborate with hardware and software engineers to ensure firmware and hardware compatibility.

Test and integrate firmware with other software and systems.

Maintain and improve firmware for the current and new generation of devices.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Qualifications and Experience

Required

5+ years of firmware development experience (C, C++, etc.).

Familiarity with FreeRTOS in a multitasking environment.

Experience with ESP32 IDF.

Experience with ARM-based MCUs.

Experience with LVGL.

Experience with I2C, SPI, UART, and JTAG communication protocols.

Experience designing, implementing, and testing finite-state machines.

Experience with board-level hardware debugging.

Familiarity with Git flow.


Preferred

Familiarity with code coverage and static analysis tools.

Experience with unit testing in C, preferably with MCU development.

Experience with writing and using test scripts.

Understanding and passion about cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology.

Understanding of public key cryptography, including asymmetric keys and ECDSA in particular.

Experience designing and testing secure embedded systems.

Familiarity with WIFI, BLE, Serial, MQTT, and similar protocols.

title: Staff Full Stack Engineer - Glider
location: Remote first, overlap with EST timezone

jobsdetail.description:
Big push from this client as they're really keen to see more profiles!

What is Glider?

Glider is building the next generation of investing. We’re focused on long-term, diversified portfolios, automated rebalancing, and calm, intelligent UX—bringing the familiarity and safeguards of traditional investing to onchain finance. Our goal is abstract away all of the complexities of DeFi to allow anyone to invest onchain.

Since launch, we’ve had over 75,000 users join Glider. As the world’s assets move on chain, everyone will need novel and better ways to manage their assets. We’re excited about RWAs, onchain stocks and bonds—real investable assets fully onchain with all of the superpowers that being onchain brings.

Glider is backed by a16z CSX, Coinbase Ventures, Uniswap Ventures, Ondo Finance, MoonPay Ventures, GSR, Selini, and many others.

What are we hiring for?

We are seeking a Full Stack Engineer to join our team and play a critical hand in developing Glider. As a full stack engineer, you will be responsible for building end-to-end features, working with cutting-edge technology, and contributing to a product that uses every piece of the crypto/DeFi stack.

Key Responsibilities:

End-to-End Development: Lead the design and development of comprehensive features for the Glider flagship product, ensuring they are scalable, secure, and efficient.

Innovative Problem Solving: Tackle unique challenges related to declarative trading and vertical solutions, bringing creative and well-architected approaches to complex problems.

Full-Stack Collaboration: Engage with every layer of the crypto/DeFi stack, from backend infrastructure to on-chain swaps and frontend Web3 UX, ensuring seamless integration and functionality.

Experience: 5+ years of experience in software engineering, with a focus on full-stack development and a deep understanding of both frontend and backend technologies.

Tech Stack Proficiency:

Web3: Familiarity with Viem/Wagmi, permissionless.js/pimlico, SIWE (Sign-In with Ethereum), ZeroDev Kernel Smart Accounts.

Backend: Strong skills in Node.js (TypeScript), GCP, AlloyDB, Axiom & Sentry, with the ability to work with Python-based solvers.

Frontend: Expertise in Next.js, tRPC, TypeScript, Tailwind + Radix UI, Zustand, react-spring, Vitest & Synpress.

Problem-Solving Skills: Proven ability to design and implement novel solutions in a fast-paced, innovative environment.

Passion for Crypto: A deep interest in the crypto and DeFi, with a strong desire to push the boundaries of what is possible onchain.

Work on problems that actually matter—wealth, access, and long-term investing. (We’re not building a casino.)

title: Partner Engineer - Defuse Labs
location: European timezones strongly preferred but will consider people who can overlap 6+ hours a day

jobsdetail.description:
Description

About us


Defuse Labs develops NEAR Intents to enable seamless cross-chain interactions in an automated world — connecting AI, services, and financial applications. At Defuse Labs we design intent-driven liquidity layers, where smart contracts breathe, AI transacts and chains sync in real-time With expertise in AI, cryptography, and decentralized finance, our team is redefining how intelligent agents interact across blockchain networks.


We invite you to be part of the team to support development and further maintenance of Near Intents. As a key player in the industry, Near Intents fosters a culture of excellence, collaboration, and forward-thinking. We are operating in a startup mode that values creativity, agility, and a strong sense of purpose. The mission is to build a decentralized future where financial systems are open, transparent, and accessible to everyone.


We are looking for a Partner Engineer (DevRel) to drive adoption, manage strategic partnerships, and engage with the developer ecosystem around NearIntents. This role blends hands-on engineering expertise with developer advocacy, requiring a deep technical understanding of the NEAR ecosystem and the ability to support developers across multiple channels. You will be the Point of Contact (PoC) for integrations, ensuring developers and users can easily leverage Near Intents in their applications.


Key Responsibilities


Integrations & Adoption

Drive the adoption of Near Intents by working closely with partners and developers to integrate it into their applications.

Work closely with developers to integrate Near Intents, solving technical challenges and optimizing implementations.

Write high-quality technical documentation, tutorials, and example repositories; create technical resources (guides, tutorials, SDKs) to accelerate integrations.

Debug and troubleshoot issues, providing direct engineering support to partners and ecosystem projects.

Identify and address technical barriers, ensuring smooth implementation across various projects.


Developer Support & Advocacy

Serve as the primary Point of Contact (PoC) for partners and users, answering technical inquiries and troubleshooting issues.

Actively support and engage with developers across Telegram, GitHub, Twitter, and forums to provide real-time assistance.

Advocate for developer needs internally, ensuring Near Intents evolves in alignment with community feedback.


Technical Expertise & Enablement

Maintain a deep understanding of Near Intents and its underlying technology to effectively assist developers.

Conduct workshops, AMAs, and office hours to educate and empower the community.

Develop example use cases, reference implementations, and best practices to showcase the power of Near Intents.


Ecosystem Engagement & Growth

Collaborate with ecosystem projects, tooling providers, and infrastructure teams to expand the reach of Near Intents.

Build relationships with key developers, fostering a strong technical community around Near Intents.

Monitor adoption metrics and provide insights to continuously improve developer experience.

Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts clearly.

Comfortable supporting partners, developers and users across multiple chanels, troubleshooting technical issues, and writing clear documentation.

Passionate about building and nurturing developer ecosystems.

location: North America preferred (Would consider South America if can work EST working hours)

jobsdetail.description:
Important: Please read the following before referring candidates

No crypto exp on the CV

They want someone with startupy/scale up exp (Someone who has only worked at big corporate companies will not be of interest to the CTO


Who We Are:

We build infrastructure that delivers massive amounts of web data to the companies training the world’s most powerful AI models.

We're the team that helps to power and support Grass, a bandwidth-sharing network that lets us operate a massive distributed crawler, giving us unique access to high-quality public web data at global scale. On top of that, we’ve built pipelines for ingesting, segmenting, and annotating billions of videos, transcripts, and audio files, powering dataset creation for frontier labs.

We’re lean, technical, and move fast. No red tape, no slow decision-making; just a team of builders pushing to expand what’s possible for open web data and AI.


The Role.

We are looking for a Embedded Systems Engineer who is experienced and brings deep expertise in backend and firmware development. You will join a small, talented team and lead efforts to architect scalable solutions, build and optimize low-level systems, drive technical excellence, and support our vision for a future where Grass plays a critical role in shaping the internet's evolution.


Who You Are.

BS or MS degree in a STEM major or equivalent job experience required

4+ years experience in software development and writing very high quality code that is robust and easy to maintain

Knowledge on how to build large scalable systems

Experience with low-level programming, embedded systems, or firmware development for networked devices

Knowledge and experience in identifying and solving issues with intricate, live software systems, as well as in-depth familiarity with contemporary software development processes such as continuous integration and continuous deployment

Professional or native English language proficiency
jobsdetail.requirement:
What You'll Be Doing.

Develop new features and software improvements across backend and firmware layers

Test, deploy and debug backend API and firmware services

Write clear, tested, documented code for both application and embedded systems

Create and review technical design, code, and documentation

Contribute to Wynd’s infrastructure which includes mobile, desktop, embedded, and server-side applications

Technologies Used.

C, Go, Javascript, firmware toolchains and embedded systems libraries
jobsdetail.benefits:
Why Work With Us:

Opportunity. We are at at the forefront of developing a web-scale crawler and knowledge graph that allows ordinary people to participate in the process, and share in the benefits of AI development.

Culture. We’re a lean team working together to achieve a very ambitious goal of improving access to public web data and distributing the value of AI to the people. We prioritize low ego and high output.

Work Remotely

Compensation. You’ll receive a competitive salary, benefits and equity package

You’ll receive a competitive salary, benefits and equity package

About Grass

Grass is the world’s first Layer 2 Data Rollup. It exists as a source for AI training data, which it obtains from public websites using a vast network of web scraping nodes. These nodes are operated voluntarily by residential internet users, and users are rewarded for their participation. Data procured on the network is then cleaned and processed into structured datasets before being added to Grass’s growing data repository for use in AI training.

jobsdetail.description:
Description

Head of Marketing

Craft the Story of How Ethereum Wins Institutional Adoption


Why Etherealize?

Etherealize is bringing the real world to Ethereum. We are building the infrastructure for Wall Street to operate on Ethereum-based rails and move the financial system into the 21st century.


We are looking for a visionary marketing leader to help us revolutionize financial markets with next-generation technology. You will be joining a team dedicated to unlocking the true potential of on-chain finance, creating a world where traditional assets flow seamlessly through blockchain protocols.


Etherealize has a series of exciting products that will be revealed in 2026, and we need the right person to help amplify them to the crypto community, to Wall Street, and to the world.


What Will You Do?

You will report directly to the CEO and own the marketing function, driving strategy and execution to position Etherealize as the bridge between institutional finance and Ethereum.


Strategy & Narrative

Craft narratives for two distinct audiences:

Wall Street (credit market agents, investment executives)

Web3 (crypto-natives, technologists)

Lead the elevation of the Etherealize parent brand

Manage distinct sub-brand strategies for the upcoming product suite


Content & Social

Own the content marketing machine

Oversee production of short- and long-form writing and educational content

Manage external writers to scale output


Brand Evolution

Balance crypto techno-futurism with Wall Street conservatism

Ensure messaging effectively balances the needs of multiple stakeholders


Events & Ecosystem Engagement

Oversee presence at high-impact industry events

Host community dinners

Secure speaking engagements

Maintain strong relationships with the Ethereum community

Rally the ETH community around institutional adoption wins

Signal to institutions that Ethereum is the go-to platform for tokenization and on-chain business activity


Go-to-Market & Product Launches

Orchestrate high-impact launches for upcoming stealth initiatives, including:


Institutional Product BD Materials

Sales collateral for institutional prospects at the top of the BD funnel


Infrastructure Positioning

Messaging for the core technology stack targeting web3 builders and developers


Institutional Platform Rollout

Marketing artifacts supporting the launch of the institutional protocol

Etherealize is an institutional marketing and product arm for the Ethereum ecosystem. New Reinforced Learning Engineer position with Baton Corporation.

Must be based in NYC or open to relocating to NYC & working office based.


Who We Are


We are Baton Corporation, a team of elite builders, moving fast and redefining what's possible. We're a high-growth software development company and proud contributors to pump.fun, the largest crypto social network globally. We build for the future.


Job description:

Own and ship an RL-driven trading agent using real capital to increase trading volume and user participation in a memecoin ecosystem.

Design reward functions and policies aligned with product goals while enforcing strict downside risk constraints.

Build evaluation and validation frameworks (simulation, offline analysis) to minimize reliance on live sequential testing.

Safely transition an existing heuristic-based production system toward learning-based approaches.

Take end-to-end ownership and technical leadership as the sole RL expert, from data and modeling through deployment, monitoring, and safeguards.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Requirements:

Has already put an autonomous learning system into production that directly controlled capital, pricing, traffic, or resources and can explain what broke and how they fixed it.

Has personally designed and enforced hard risk limits (capital caps, loss bounds, circuit breakers) in a live system, not just talked about “risk-aware objectives.”

Has built a policy evaluation loop from scratch (simulators, replay, counterfactuals, shadow deployments) before trusting live rollout.

Can make and defend uncomfortable tradeoffs (e.g. heuristic > RL, bandit > deep RL) based on empirical results instead of ideology

Has operated as the single owner of a complex ML system in a small team, with no safety net of research orgs, infra teams, or “ML platforms.”

Hiring Criteria

Has personally designed and enforced hard risk limits (capital caps, loss bounds, circuit breakers) in a live system, not just talked about “risk-aware objectives.”

Has built a policy evaluation loop from scratch (simulators, replay, counterfactuals, shadow deployments) before trusting live rollout.

Can make and defend uncomfortable tradeoffs (e.g. heuristic > RL, bandit > deep RL) based on empirical results instead of ideology.

Has operated as the single owner of a complex ML system in a small team, with no safety net of research orgs, infra teams, or “ML platforms.”

Description

Baton Corporation is a team of elite builders moving fast and redefining what’s possible. We’re a high-growth software development company and proud contributors to pump.fun, the largest crypto social network in the world.

We build products at the frontier of crypto, consumer scale, and performance. Our work ships to millions of users, operates under real-world constraints, and sets the bar for speed, polish, and reliability in the space.

We are seeking a Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to take command of our financial engine. As a core member of the executive team, you will manage massive liquidity, optimize high-volume revenue streams, and navigate the complex intersection of social media and decentralised finance.


Key Responsibilities

Hyper-Growth Financial Strategy: Drive financial operations for a high-revenue platform, focusing on liquidity management, aggressive scaling, and real-time risk mitigation in the volatile memecoin market.

Treasury & Revenue Optimisation: Oversee the management of $800M+ in revenue, ensuring optimal cash positioning, yield strategies, and secure custody across fiat and digital assets.

Solana Ecosystem Integration: Optimize crypto payment processing, exchange integrations, and liquidity routing specific to the Solana network and pump.fun ecosystem.

Regulatory & Tax Navigation: Own the strategy for complex global tax obligations and compliance challenges unique to high-velocity crypto social platforms.

Executive Relationship Management: Maintain high-level relationships with account managers at banks, payment processors, and Tier-1 crypto exchanges to ensure seamless operations.

Hands-on Financial Controls: Implement robust reporting structures and policies from the ground up, moving fast from "startup mode" to institutional-grade financial governance.

Team Building: Recruit and lead a high-performing finance team that can keep pace with our elite engineering and product squads.

Operational Grit: Proven ability to "grind"—you are as comfortable building a 5-year strategic model as you are performing manual reconciliation or grunt work to ensure accuracy.

The "Elite Builder" Mindset: Experience in hyper-growth tech where speed is a competitive advantage; you must be able to drive financial insights that support split-second executive decisions.

Regulatory Mastery: Strong grasp of the evolving global regulatory landscape for tokens, social finance (SocialFi), and crypto-native revenue models.

Negotiation Skills: A master negotiator capable of optimizing terms with financial service providers and vendors to protect the company’s bottom line.

jobsdetail.description:
New role with Sei Labs - this is an urgent requirement! They're looking for more junior profiles who can work onsite with 1-4 years experience.


Description

About Sei Labs

Sei Labs builds open sourced technology for the high-performance Sei Blockchain, the first parallelized EVM Layer 1 blockchain designed to scale with the industry. The unique optimizations built into Sei enable Web3 applications to reach Web2 level scale and performance, driving the mass adoption of digital assets.

Our teams are comprised of former Google, Goldman Sachs, Robinhood, Nvidia, and Databricks veterans dedicated to onboarding the next billion users onto a vibrant ecosystem of applications.

Sei Labs has raised over $30M from top investors including Jump Crypto, Multicoin Capital, Coinbase Ventures, Distributed Global, Hudson River Trading, and Flow Traders.

Check out our website and docs for more details.


Recruitment at Sei Labs

We’re looking to hire our first Sourcer / Talent Acquisition Specialist to help us build the most talent dense Engineering team in web3. This role will report directly into our Head of Talent. It is the perfect learning ground for someone early in their recruiting career who is ambitious and hungry to grow, with a strong bias toward action and ownership.

You’ll have an incredible opportunity to work directly with our founders and leadership team to shape hiring strategy for some of the most critical roles at Sei. You’ll spend the majority of your time sourcing and engaging the pinnacle of web3 engineering talent for highly technical roles, while also contributing to longer-term talent strategy, market mapping, recruiting operations, and wider HR work.

This is not a passive recruiting role. It’s for someone who thrives in fast-moving high-autonomy environments, and wants real responsibility.


Responsibilities

Proactively attract, network with, and source the top decile of tech + non-tech talent in web3

Own and strategize how to build a consistent top-of-funnel pipeline for our toughest and most high impact searches

Partner directly with our Founder and Engineering Leaders on market mapping, talent strategy, and hiring priorities

Contribute to wider HR work, recruiting operations, tooling, and automation projects as we scale

Strong learning mindset and proven enthusiasm for Web3

1–4 years of experience in sourcing talent, with exposure to technical or engineering roles

At least 1 years of experience in web3 specific talent pools or crypto adjacent companies (CEX’s / blockchain analytics / etc.)

Proven ability to run outbound sourcing end-to-end and manage multiple pipelines simultaneously

Strong written communication skills and comfort engaging highly technical candidates

High grit, resilience, and comfort operating in a fast-paced startup environment

About the Role

We’re looking for a Product Designer to help bring early-stage product ideas and new initiatives to life. This role sits at the intersection of brand, product, and marketing, with a focus on defining the first visual expression of new ideas—from landing pages and launch moments to early product visuals.

You’ll work closely with a small, fast-moving team to shape how new projects look, feel, and communicate value from day one. This is a hands-on role for a designer with strong visual taste, comfort with ambiguity, and excitement about building the first version of things.


What You’ll Do

Help define the visual direction for new initiatives and early-stage projects, including brand identity, look & feel, and storytelling.

Design early landing pages, launch assets, and marketing surfaces to support new ideas as they come to market.

Own end-to-end visual design projects, from early concepts through polished execution and launch.

Collaborate closely with design, product, engineering, marketing, and leadership partners to turn loose ideas into clear, compelling visuals.

Contribute visual design and polish to product experiences as projects evolve.

Maintain a high bar for craft, detail, and clarity across everything you ship.

Experiment with and incorporate AI and emerging tools to improve ideation, iteration speed, and production quality.

Balance creative exploration with practical execution in a fast-moving environment.

About the Role

As a Senior Data Engineer, you’ll own the reliability, quality, and performance of Stan’s data pipelines and integrations. You’ll build and maintain the data infrastructure that powers analytics, decision-making, and AI products used by thousands of creators. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys operating under real ownership — keeping systems running, fixing what breaks, and designing infrastructure that scales.


Key Responsibilities

Own the health, reliability, and performance of production data pipelines across the company.

Build, maintain, and debug ETL/ELT pipelines feeding analytics, AI systems, and internal tools.

Ensure data quality, monitoring, and alerting so issues are caught early and fixed fast.

Design and maintain integrations across the data stack (APIs, warehouses, orchestration, downstream consumers).

Support and extend AI and agentic systems by building robust data and context pipelines.

Partner closely with data science, product, and engineering to enable data-driven decision-making.

Proactively improve infrastructure to prevent failures and scale with the business.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Required

Strong Python and SQL skills (non-negotiable).

Hands-on experience building and owning production ETL/ELT pipelines.

Experience with cloud data warehouses (Snowflake or similar).

Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow or equivalent).

Experience implementing data quality checks, monitoring, and alerting.

Comfort debugging complex data issues in production environments.

Strong communication skills and ability to partner with non-data stakeholders.


Nice to have

Experience with AWS (ECS, Lambdas, RDS).

Hands-on work with Airbyte, DBT, or similar tools.

Experience building API integrations or scraping pipelines.

Exposure to LLMs, agentic systems, or AI data pipelines.

Experience supporting early-stage or fast-growing startups.


Quick self-check


If you’ve owned pipelines end-to-end and been responsible when things break, you’re likely a strong fit.

title: Quant / Trading Engineer — Senpi Markets, oracle and index-first - Senpi
location: US remote preferred, open to Europe for strong candidates

jobsdetail.description:
Description

About Senpi

Senpi is building perpetual markets on onchain economic activity.

Instead of pricing assets or narratives, Senpi Markets allow traders and autonomous agents to take directional exposure to how different parts of the onchain economy are growing or decaying—applications, protocols, infrastructure, and capital flows.

These markets are deployed directly into the Hyperliquid ecosystem via HIP-3, with discovery, execution, and automation optimized through the Senpi app.

This is early, foundational work at the intersection of quantitative finance, crypto market structure, and onchain data systems.

Role requirement

Hyperliquid experience is not required for this role.

Strong derivatives and market structure intuition is required.

Crypto-native familiarity is strongly preferred but not mandatory if the candidate has directly relevant pricing and index construction experience.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Mission

Own oracle and index construction for new onchain perpetual markets, with a focus on integrity, determinism, and manipulation resistance.

What they do

Define index methodologies from raw onchain data

Design smoothing and normalization and manipulation-resistant aggregation logic

Specify and implement oracle pipelines: data quality, update cadence, failover

Work with product and engineering to launch, monitor, and iterate markets

Must-have profile

Experience designing indices, oracle systems, pricing systems, or market data products

Strong quantitative rigor and engineering execution for data pipelines and correctness under adversarial conditions

Ability to reason about manipulation, incentives, and data integrity
jobsdetail.benefits:
Why This Role Matters

You will help define a new category of financial markets

Your decisions directly shape liquidity formation, capital allocation, and agent behavior

This is foundational infrastructure, not a feature

The impact compounds as volume scales

If Senpi Markets succeed, this role will have helped define how the onchain economy itself is priced.

Interview Process

1.Founder / CEO Interview

2.Hiring Manager Interview

3.Technical Assignment

4.Final Interview

About Senpi

Backed by $4.5M in recent funding from Lemniscap and Coinbase Ventures, Senpi’s vision is bold and concrete: to become the “Waymo of onchain trading” — fully autonomous trading agents that help users navigate, outperform, and ultimately beat the markets.

We believe trading is transitioning from:

manual → assisted → automated → autonomous

Senpi is building the infrastructure and intelligence layer that makes that future possible.

Senpi co-founders Jason Goldberg, Sarvesh Jain, and Ignas Peciura have been innovating together on Ethereum since 2017 and at the edge of blockchain x AI since 2022. This is an opportunity to join a crack team that’s aggressively pioneering the future of trading.

Benefits

Healthcare coverage

Latest gadgets

https://senpi.ai/
jobsdetail.other:
Hiring Criteria

Proficiency in Python (and/or similar languages) and comfort with performant, production-grade code.

Strong quantitative foundation (math, physics, engineering, CS, or equivalent)

Experience designing or owning: Indexes, signals, trading metrics, or financial data products

Strong derivatives experience and market structure intuition

Recruiting Tips

Candidate pre-interview prep for this role!!!

Senpi Markets is building new onchain perpetual markets that require high-integrity oracle and index construction.

Please come prepared by:

Be prepared to discuss oracle and index methodologies for creating onchain perps that price revenue growth rates of onchain protocols (based on their onchain fees collected).

Explaining how you would make the methodology deterministic, manipulation-resistant, and operationally reliable

For each idea, include:

Data inputs and update cadence

Aggregation and smoothing approach

Manipulation vectors and mitigations

Validation and monitoring plan

jobsdetail.description:
📝 About the Role

This role is for a hands-on Data Scientist who wants to be embedded directly with product and business teams, owning problems end-to-end from question to impact. You’ll partner closely with operators and builders to turn messy data into clear decisions, systems, and shipped outcomes. If you care about leverage, ownership, and seeing your work directly shape real products used by thousands of creators, this role is for you.

Reports to: Head of Data

🔑 Key responsibilities

Be embedded with one or more product or business teams, acting as their primary data science partner.

Translate ambiguous questions into clear analyses, experiments, and metrics that drive decisions.

Build and maintain data models, pipelines, and dashboards that teams actually use.

Design and evaluate experiments and opportunity sizing to guide product, growth, and AI initiatives.

Apply ML, LLMs, and agentic systems to real product and business problems.

Push back when needed — using data to challenge assumptions and guide strategy.

Own outcomes, not just outputs — success is measured by impact, not reports delivered.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Baseline qualifications

You have 3+ years of hands-on, applied data science experience.

You’re strong in Python and SQL — this is non-negotiable.

You’ve worked closely with product, growth, or business teams, not just on ad hoc analytics.

You’re comfortable operating in ambiguous, fast-moving environments.

Technical signals we’re looking for

You’ve designed and run experiments and can clearly interpret results.

You have strong fundamentals in data modeling (Kimball/Ross style).

You’ve built data pipelines and dashboards that teams actually rely on.

You’ve worked hands-on with ML and/or LLMs (production work, internal tools, or serious side projects).

Ownership + communication

You can clearly explain how your work changed a decision or outcome.

You’re comfortable pushing back using data when something doesn’t make sense.

You’re seen as a trusted thought partner by non-data stakeholders, not just a service function.

Strong bonus signals

You’ve shipped AI or data-powered features end-to-end.

You’ve built scrappy systems before they were “perfect.”

You’ve been the go-to data person for a team or product.

Quick litmus test: If you’ve owned metrics, driven experiments, and shipped systems — not just answered questions — you’re likely interview-ready.

About the Company

Stan is the Shopify for content creators, helping anyone make a living working for themselves online. In just four years, the team has built a $35M+ ARR business by focusing relentlessly on products that creators actually use and love. Backed by top-tier investors and builders, Stan is scaling fast — with data at the center of how decisions get made.

jobsdetail.description:
About the Role

As a UX Researcher at Stan, you’ll shape the product by deeply understanding creators at every stage of their journey and translating their needs into clear, actionable insights. You’ll plan and run qualitative and quantitative research, synthesize complex signals into patterns, and partner closely with Design, Product, Engineering, and Data to influence real product decisions. This is a high-impact role for a researcher who cares about craft, collaboration, and ensuring human insight sits at the center of a fast-growing creator platform.

Key responsibilities

Watch user sessions and interpret and gather insights and formulating into patterns

Plan and conduct qualitative and quantitative user research across the Creator lifecycle

Run user interviews, usability testing, and concept validation to inform product direction

Analyze user behavior through session reviews, surveys, and data synthesis

Translate research findings into clear insights, opportunity areas, and actionable recommendations

Partner closely with Design, Product, Engineering, and Data to influence roadmap and priorities

Create research plans, discussion guides, and reports that scale knowledge across teams

Advocate for creator needs and ensure user evidence is central to decision-making

jobsdetail.description:
About the Role

As Engineering Manager for Growth Personalization, you’ll lead the team building Zapier’s personalization platform that powers contextual, data-driven experiences across the product. You’ll set technical strategy and guide execution for systems that enable experimentation, recommendations, search, and real-time personalization at scale. This role is ideal for an engineering leader with prior growth experience in a SaaS environment who enjoys owning high-impact infrastructure, partnering closely with Product and Data, and driving meaningful improvements to activation and retention.

Reports to: Engineering

Key responsibilities

Lead and grow the Personalization Platform engineering team, providing technical direction, coaching, and performance support.

Define and own the technical strategy for personalization, experimentation, search, and growth infrastructure in partnership with Product and Data.

Drive execution on scalable, reliable systems that power recommendations, A/B testing, feature flagging, and real-time personalization.

Build self-serve tools and platforms that enable product teams to ship personalized experiences without engineering bottlenecks.

Partner closely with Data to integrate user context, segmentation, and ML models into product experiences.

Ensure high standards for system reliability, performance, and operational excellence across personalization infrastructure.

Participate in architecture decisions, code reviews, and technical discussions, staying hands-on enough to guide quality and tradeoffs.

Communicate clearly with stakeholders and leadership, balancing technical debt, delivery, and business impact.

Hire, onboard, and develop engineers while continuously improving team processes and ways of working.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Experience & leadership

You have 3+ years of engineering management experience, leading teams working on growth, personalization, search, experimentation, or platform systems.

You have experience accelerating growth of B2B SaaS products

You’ve successfully led teams through ambiguous, fast-moving environments and shifting priorities.

You have experience hiring, coaching, and developing engineers, including performance management when needed.

Technical depth

You bring strong hands-on experience with modern web and backend technologies, including TypeScript, Python, Node.js, GraphQL, and Next.js.

You’ve contributed to architecture and system design for scalable, production-grade platforms.

You’re comfortable participating in code reviews and technical discussions, even if you’re not coding daily.

Personalization & growth expertise

You understand personalization strategies, including experimentation, user segmentation, and recommendation systems.

You’ve partnered closely with Data teams on A/B testing, metrics, and ML model integration.

You’ve built or scaled systems that directly support activation, engagement, or retention.

Collaboration & communication

You communicate clearly in writing and verbally, especially in remote-first environments.

You can balance technical quality with business needs and help stakeholders make informed tradeoffs.

You’re trusted by Product and Data partners as a thoughtful, solutions-oriented leader.

Strong bonus signals

You’ve led platform or self-service tooling used by multiple product teams.

You’ve navigated system migrations or major architectural changes.

You enjoy building infrastructure that quietly powers impact at scale.

Quick self-check

If you’ve led teams building personalization or experimentation platforms and enjoy pairing technical strategy with people leadership, you’re likely interview-ready

jobsdetail.description:
ob Overview

This role centers on building and optimizing advanced AI-driven systems that bring agentic workflows to life. You’ll design and implement LLM-powered pipelines with continuous evaluation and feedback loops, develop organization-specific customization layers, and create engaging voice- and message-based agents. Beyond deep technical execution, you’ll collaborate closely with product teams, stakeholders, and users to shape product direction and translate real-world needs into scalable solutions. With expertise in machine learning and production AI systems (RAG, vector search, prompt engineering) and strong Rails proficiency, you’ll architect reliable infrastructure that integrates seamlessly into complex environments. The ideal candidate is both an innovative builder and a clear communicator, able to thrive in ambiguity, adapt quickly to new frameworks, and deliver impactful, enterprise-grade AI solutions at speed.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities

As a Senior AI Engineer, you’ll play a foundational role in shaping Arist’s next generation of AI-driven products. This is not a purely heads-down engineering role — in addition to designing and shipping advanced agentic systems, you’ll collaborate directly with product teams, founders, and users to shape product direction and turn feedback into production-grade technical solutions. Your work will bridge deep technical execution with thoughtful communication and iteration.

Design and implement agentic workflows powered by LLMs for real-world task execution.

Build customization layers tailored to organization-specific logic and requirements.

Collaborate directly with product teams, founders, and users to understand pain points, shape product direction, and iterate quickly on prototypes.

Translate user and product feedback into scalable, production-grade technical solutions.

Develop voice-based and message-based learning agents that drive engagement, incorporating evaluation, feedback loops, and continuous monitoring.

Architect AI pipelines (RAG, prompt engineering, evaluation) and build reliable infrastructure that integrates into complex environments.

Clearly communicate technical decisions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring alignment across teams.

Manage multi-agent orchestration and core AI system infrastructure.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Qualifications

Machine Learning Expertise

5+ years of experience in ML (PyTorch, TensorFlow).

2+ years of hands-on experience working with LLMs (Hugging Face, OpenAI, Anthropic).

AI System Development

Proven experience building and deploying production AI systems, including RAG and vector search.

Knowledge of prompt engineering, AI safety, and content filtering best practices.

Comfort architecting scalable infrastructure that integrates into complex environments.

Technical Proficiency

Familiarity with Rails is a plus, but not required — strong candidates can ramp up quickly.

Experience working with REST APIs, PostgreSQL, ActiveRecord, and RSpec.

Understanding of frameworks like LangChain or LlamaIndex, or the ability to learn them rapidly.

Communication & Collaboration

Proven ability to engage directly with users, customers, and cross-functional teams to gather feedback and shape technical solutions.

Comfortable explaining complex concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Experience collaborating with product and design teams to align on goals and iterate quickly.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Builder Mindset

Thrives in ambiguity, learns quickly, and iterates fast in lean environments.

Excited to work in a small, high-impact team where communication and ownership are key.

Ideal Candidate

Ideal Candidate Profile

Innovative Builder — Designs and optimizes sophisticated AI workflows that solve real enterprise challenges, from ideation to deployment.

Product-Minded Communicator — Excels at working directly with users, clients, and cross-functional teams to gather feedback and translate it into scalable technical solutions. Comfortable navigating both technical deep dives and high-level product conversations.

Technically Excellent — Brings strong expertise in Rails (REST APIs, PostgreSQL, ActiveRecord, RSpec) and hands-on experience deploying scalable AI systems using modern frameworks and infrastructure.

Collaborative and Fast-Moving — Thrives in ambiguity, learns new frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, etc.) quickly, and delivers results at startup speed. Works seamlessly with founders, engineers, and product teams to iterate rapidly.

jobsdetail.other:
Arist is growing ~4x YoY, will hit ~$10M ARR and be profitable by EOY, has zero competitors, is a lean team of 18, and pays exceptionally well. Arist is building end-to-end agents to replace HR and Training teams and make learning 10x better. Clients include Microsoft and Novartis.

Arist began with a bold vision: to deliver entrepreneurship education to high school students in conflict zones through text messages—meeting learners where they already were, even without internet or laptops. From that origin, Arist has grown into a full-stack, AI-powered enablement platform that helps enterprises deliver training, nudges, surveys, and communications seamlessly through SMS, Slack, Microsoft Teams, WhatsApp, email, and more.

Our “push-based” model bypasses traditional LMS systems to meet employees where attention already lives. Today, Arist powers mission-critical learning and enablement for global enterprises, bridging the gap between intent and action through AI agents that handle need analysis, content creation, delivery, and analytics at scale.

Company Culture

Arist’s culture is rooted in mission, pragmatism, and impact. We believe learning should be frictionless, embedded in daily workflows, and designed for real-world results. Our team values thoughtful, asynchronous communication (memo-driven), rapid iteration powered by AI, and uncompromising standards of enterprise reliability.

Rather than buzzwords, our culture is defined by outcomes: a relentless focus on solving measurable business problems, empowering teammates to think independently, and building with agility and purpose.

Company Size:

30

Industry:

AI-enabled microlearning, enterprise Learning & Development (L&D), and edtech

Founded:

2019

Headquarters:

New York, New York

Total Funding:

https://arist.com/

$16 million

What you can expect

Day to Day

You’ll spend your days designing, building, and shipping AI systems that deliver immediate real-world impact. Your time will be split between hands-on development (Rails, ML/LLM workflows), collaborating with founders and engineers to shape product direction, and rapidly iterating on prototypes based on real feedback. Most days blend deep technical work with fast feedback loops from both internal stakeholders and enterprise clients, giving you direct visibility into how your work moves the product forward.

Team

You’ll join a lean, highly technical founding team, reporting directly to the CTO and collaborating closely with the CEO and product leads. The team is composed of engineers with backgrounds in AI/ML, backend systems, and enterprise software, all focused on building production-grade AI enablement tools. You’ll have significant ownership and autonomy, with the ability to shape architecture, standards, and culture.

Growth

This is a founding-level role with significant opportunities for advancement. You’ll have the chance to:

  • Own core technical systems from day one.
  • Mentor and grow future engineers as the team scales.
  • Influence product strategy at both the technical and business levels.
  • Build a track record of shipping AI systems at scale — positioning yourself for leadership roles within Arist or in future ventures.

Interview Process

Initial Call (30 min) – Introductory conversation with a recruiter or founder to review background, motivations, and role fit.

Technical Deep Dive (60–90 min) – Live discussion with senior engineers covering LLM design scenarios, Rails integration, and system-level problem solving.

Practical Exercise / Case Study – Short take-home or live coding assignment focused on building or evaluating an AI workflow.

Final Round (60 min) – Cultural and cross-functional interviews with founders/team to assess collaboration, communication, and alignment with mission.

From one of the Co Founders on what he's looking for in terms of portfolio/Github/Links - "I mostly want to see folks that have shipped/worked on beautiful products (either at big co or startups or even side projects) e.g. family.co wallet is beautifully designed, rainbow as well. I mostly want to see candidates with good taste & craft,

Description

Senior Mobile Engineer — React Native

Who We Are

PVP is building the next generation of DeFi trading, powered by Hyperliquid. Our mission is to democratize access to global financial markets—including crypto, equities, and commodities—by leveraging decentralized technology.

As the largest builder on Hyperliquid, we have:

Processed $65B+ in cumulative trading volume.

Generated eight figures in revenue over the past year.

Grown to over 400,000 registered traders.

We are a small, elite team of individual contributors who value autonomy, ownership, and rapid execution. We operate in a low-process, high-trust environment, ideal for those who thrive in 0-to-1 phases and want to be directly responsible for products used by millions.

Why This Role Matters

Mobile is our most personal and emotionally resonant surface. It is where traders experience confidence, urgency, and flow.

We believe React Native can deliver experiences indistinguishable from native apps when crafted with care. In this role, you will sit at the intersection of engineering, design, and product, turning raw speed into a premium experience that feels intentional in the palm of a user's hand.

What You’ll Do

Set Direction: Drive the technical and experiential roadmap for PVP’s mobile platform.

Build High-Performance UIs: Develop elegant React Native interfaces for real-time trading, analytics, and social features.

Craft Motion: Implement fluid animations, expressive gestures, and tactile feedback to create a "premium" feel.

Architect Systems: Design a resilient real-time data layer using TypeScript to handle WebSockets and connectivity changes gracefully.

Bridge Native Modules: Unlock advanced platform capabilities or UI primitives not achievable in JavaScript alone.

Collaborate: Partner with backend engineers to design bandwidth-efficient APIs and data flows.

Iterate & Polish: Continuously identify and fix UI jank, visual inconsistencies, and performance bottlenecks.
jobsdetail.requirement:
What You’ll Bring

Experience: 5+ years of shipping production React Native applications using TypeScript.

Animation Mastery: Deep hands-on experience with React Native Reanimated and React Native Gesture Handler.

Visual Flair: Experience with Shopify React Native Skia or similar low-level rendering tools for custom charts and visuals.

Performance Expertise: Proven ability to maintain 60 FPS experiences across complex animated lists and real-time views.

Platform Knowledge: Strong understanding of iOS and Android layout, motion, and interaction nuances.

Product Mindset: Experience owning features end-to-end—from initial prototype to App Store/Play Store release

Tooling: Familiarity with profiling using Flipper, Xcode Instruments, or Android Studio.

Bonus Points

Native experience in Swift/SwiftUI or Kotlin.

A background in highly interactive consumer products (trading apps, games, or creative tools).

Open-source contributions to the React Native ecosystem.

Tokens/Equity also part of the package

We combine real-time market data, social leaderboards and a playful points system to turn trading into a team sport. The platform routinely handles sub-second position updates and billions of dollars of volume every month.

Description

Who we are

PVP is building the next generation of DeFi trading powered by Hyperliquid. Our mission is to democratize access to global financial markets, leveraging the power of decentralized technologies. We are the the largest builder code product on Hyperliquid and have processed north of $50B in cumulative trading volume and hit 8 figures in revenue in the past year.

We are a small, highly technical team of strong individual contributors, passionate about free markets and building ambitious systems from the ground up. We value autonomy, agency, and rapid execution. Our culture is low-process, high-trust, and focused on results—ideal for self-starters who thrive in ambiguous, 0-to-1 environments.

The Role

You will lead the design, implementation, and deployment of smart contracts on HyperEVM, building DeFi primitives and trading infrastructure that can scale to millions of traders and billions in daily volume.

What you will do

Own protocol development on HyperEVM: design, implement, and ship production-grade contracts powering positions, collateral, fee routing, and settlement flows.

Architect DeFi primitives end-to-end: staking/locking, liquidity & fee mechanisms, vaults, and risk controls (circuit breakers, caps, kill-switches, guardians) with explicit gas/latency budgets.

Engineer safe upgradeability: choose patterns (UUPS/transparent/beacon), write storage-layout tests, and preserve invariants through migrations and staged rollouts.

Harden security & correctness: model MEV/price manipulation threats; write invariants and fuzz tests (Foundry/Echidna); integrate static analysis (Slither); lead audit scope/response; own post-mortems.

Drive operational excellence: define on-chain SLOs, emit analytics-ready events, build monitors/alerts, and own incident response with rollback/patch runbooks.
jobsdetail.requirement:
What you bring

Bring deep EVM expertise with 5+ years shipping production Solidity (Yul/Huff a plus) and 8+ years overall engineering, with mastery of patterns like access control, upgradeability, proxies, Create2, and minimal clones.

Demonstrate strong DeFi systems intuition with hands-on experience across AMMs, staking/locking, stablecoin mechanics, liquidations, fee accounting, and oracle design under adversarial conditions.

Operate with pro-grade tooling—Foundry (forge/anvil/cast), Tenderly, Slither, Echidna/fuzzing, gas profiling, and storage-layout diffs—and comfort with viem/TypeScript for deployments and indexers.

Lead with a security mindset by anticipating failure modes (reentrancy, price manipulation, rounding/precision, griefing, approval abuse, cross-chain assumptions) and designing mitigations before they bite.

Maintain upgrade and migration discipline with a proven track record of stable storage layouts, robust migration scripts, and safe, multi-stage mainnet upgrades.

Show integration strength with oracles, signature standards (EIP-712, Permit2, 2612), account abstraction (ERC-4337), and bridging/cross-chain messaging—ideally including HyperEVM.

Exhibit data and ops literacy by designing analytics-ready events, building monitors and alerts, and treating on-chain releases with SRE rigor (runbooks, canaries, rollbacks).

Operate with high agency in low-process, high-trust, 0→1 environments.

Play a direct role in building 0->1 products and scaling them to millions of users

Healthy, catered meals daily

title: AI Data Engineer -Chaos Labs
location: USA / Europe / Israel - with a 5hour overlap with EST hours

jobsdetail.description:
New role live with Chaos Labs for AI Data Engineer - there is a headcount of 3 for the position. This is a remote role and will hire in the USA / Europe / Israel - they are looking for people with a deep understanding of the AI landscape, eg LLM's RAG architecture, MCPs. As well as a strong background in Python, API development, and SDK building.

Description

Chaos Labs builds technology that powers safer, more accessible financial markets. Our risk management systems, oracles, and AI models secure over $200 billion in assets across protocols including Aave, Jupiter, and GMX, processing more than $5 trillion in transaction volume. We recently launched Chaos AI, a financial intelligence platform that transforms complex market data into actionable insights and brings institutional-grade intelligence to everyone.

The Role:

We're looking for a Senior AI Data Engineer to design and build the agentic systems powering Chaos AI. You'll work at the intersection of LLMs, financial data, and production infrastructure, creating intelligent agents that reason, plan, and execute across complex financial workflows.

Responsibilities:

Design and build single and multi-agent systems with planning, memory, and tool use

Build and operate MCP servers with secure schemas and permissions

Develop agentic workflows using LangGraph or equivalent frameworks

Integrate LLMs via SDKs; manage prompts, structured outputs, and tool calling

Define and run LLM evaluations for quality, correctness, latency, cost, and regressions

Build observability and reliability infrastructure: logging, tracing, retries, state management

Optimize performance and cost from prototype to production

Mentor engineers and establish agentic best practices
jobsdetail.requirement:
Requirements:

5+ years software engineering; 2+ years building production AI/ML systems

Hands-on experience with agentic architectures and tool calling

Practical experience with MCP servers

Experience with LangGraph or equivalent agentic frameworks

Experience designing and operating LLM evaluation pipelines

Strong Python and API design skills

Familiarity with RAG pipelines, vector databases, and embedding-based retrieval

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with financial data, crypto/DeFi, or quantitative analysis

Background in distributed systems or high-throughput data pipelines

Contributions to open-source AI/ML projects
jobsdetail.benefits:
Our Perks:

Compensation & Equity – competitive package aligned with growth, performance, and merit

Career Growth Opportunities – be part of a rapidly expanding, global technology company with room to grow professionally

Interview Process

1 Recruiter / HR Call

30min screen with recruiter

2Hiring Manager Interview

30min screen with hiring manager to check technical fit

3 Technical Interview

1 hour technical interview with the Chief Data Scientist to check technical understanding for AI, LLMs, RAG etc

4 Technical Interview

1 hour technical interview with the Head of Product & AI to check their software engineering skills, syntax, security, programming

5 Founder / CEO Interview

30min screen with CEO to check motivation for role and company

About company:

About Chaos Labs

At Chaos Labs, we're reimagining the future of DeFi with automated, on-chain economic security systems.

Our mission is simple: Build trust and transparency in the financial markets of the future.

Trusted by leading protocols like Aave, GMX, dYdX, LayerZero, Jupiter, Optimism, Arbitrum, and Venus, Chaos Labs transforms data on risk, security, and incentive strategies into powerful tools to guide the evolution of decentralized finance.

Join us in revolutionizing decentralized finance with unparalleled security and efficiency.

Resources

Funding

https://chaoslabs.xyz/posts/chaos-labs-series-a-announcement

Benefits

Company retreats

Equity / token allocation

Family care programs

Healthcare coverage

Snacks and meals (in office)
jobsdetail.other:
Hiring Criteria

Describe a RAG or retrieval system you’ve built for high-stakes or data-dense domains. How did you choose embeddings, manage freshness, handle latency, and prevent incorrect or outdated answers

How do you evaluate LLM-powered systems in production? What metrics do you track (quality, correctness, latency, cost), and how do you detect regressions over time?

How have you used LangGraph or a similar framework to manage complex agent workflows? Can you explain how you handled branching, retries, state persistence, and error recovery?

Describe a production system you’ve built using single or multi-agent architectures. What agents existed, how did they coordinate (planning, memory, tool use), and what broke when you moved from prototype to production?

Where are you based? Do you require visa sponsorship?

jobsdetail.description:
About the Role

If you’re a high-agency rockstar who thrives in ambiguity, moves fast, and loves turning ideas into elegant, scalable systems that customers love—you will thrive here.

This role is a high leverage role in the following ways:

Strategic Impact – you will work directly with the founders to influence technical and product direction, deciding how we scale our platform and what bets we make.

End-to-End Ownership – Take ideas from rough concepts to production-ready systems – UI/UX, frontend components, and everything critical for to ensure our product is fast, reliable, and a joy to use.

Customer-Driven Development – Talk to customers, understand their needs, and turn feedback into technical solutions that directly impact their growth.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Key responsibilities

Develop product features across our platform, from technical design to implementation.

Build solutions end-to-end spanning the frontend (Typescript, React, Next.js) and backend (Python/Django/APIs), service and database layers.

Be able to build reliable user interfaces, reusable components, manage app state and optimize API calls.

Collaborate with engineering and design teams to build a robust, world class product that delights users.

Write high-quality, well-documented, and testable code while moving fast to deliver outcomes.

Maintain and optimize our codebase for performance and user experience.

100% of Must-Have need to be met:

Strong experience (5-8 years) in a full stack engineering role.

Strong frontend development skills (Typescript, React, Tailwind CSS)

Obsess over building the product with best UX and quality.

Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Demonstrate ownership and thrive in unstructured environments.

Ability to move quickly and meet tight deadlines.

Strong Plus:

Hands-on experience with Language Models and AI/ML integrations (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, etc.)

Experience with Redis for caching and session management.

Enterprise software development experience with security and compliance considerations

React

Python

Django

APIs

jobsdetail.benefits:
About the Company

At Inventive, their mission is to build intelligence that helps B2B sales teams win deals. Their  first product is a suite of AI agents sales teams to create winning proposals and RFP responses. About $1.4 Trillion worth of projects get allocated within the US alone and help the vendors in winning these deals with the help of their cutting AI agents.

Their founding team includes successful repeat founders & researchers from Google Deepmind, Stanford, UC Berkeley,  and IIT.  They graduated from Y-Combinator in the summer of 2023 and have raised a seed round from the Valley's top investors.

Their customer base and revenues are growing very fast and are looking for a rockstar engineer to join their small but rapidly growing team. If you are up for a challenge, you like to take ownership & you love working in a fast paced setting, then you have found your tribe.

🌐 Company website

https://www.inventive.ai/

title: Forward Deployment Engineer at EliseAI
location: On-site - New York City, Boston, San Francisco

jobsdetail.description:
About the Role

This is a Forward Deployment Engineer role for someone 

who likes being close to customers, products, and real-world outcomes. 

You’ll sit at the intersection of product launches, client implementations, 

and internal teams, making sure new features actually land well and deliver value.

You’ll work closely with customers, support, AI operations, product, and engineering to launch products, troubleshoot issues, and close the feedback loop between what clients need and what gets built next.

This is not a narrow role. It’s hands-on, fast-moving, and high ownership.

Key responsibilities

What You’ll Do

Program manage new product launches, including internal knowledge sessions, implementation training, and enablement materials

Use SQL and BI tools to monitor product health post-launch and partner with Support and AI Ops to fix misconfigurations

Own feedback loops by synthesizing insights from Gong calls, support tickets, surveys, and other signals

Act as the voice of the customer and help shape short- and long-term product decisions

Partner closely with Product and Engineering to improve offerings and ensure real client impact

Run discovery sessions with new customers to understand workflows and requirements

Move fast, solve real problems, and build systems that scale
jobsdetail.requirement:
What They’re Looking For

3+ years of experience at an early-stage startup in an operational or generalist role

A track record of shipping software that had real business impact

Comfort wearing multiple hats and owning outcomes end to end

Strong prioritization skills in messy, ambiguous environments

High ownership, accountability, and follow-through

Willingness to work in the office 5 days a week

Product management experience is a plus, but not required.

Why This Is Interesting

This is a chance to help write the playbook at a company scaling quickly, not just follow one. The work is intense, high-impact, and very real. You’ll learn what works by doing it, and you’ll see the direct effects of your decisions on customers and the product.

If you’re motivated by autonomy, speed, and meaningful problems, this role gives you a lot of room to grow.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Compensation & Benefits

  • Salary range: $120,000 – $200,000
  • Equity in the company
  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision
  • Fully paid parental leave
  • Commuter benefits
  • 401(k)
  • Fitness and home services stipend
  • Fully stocked kitchen and meals in the office
  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays
  • Relocation support if needed

 

Compensation is determined based on experience, skills, location, and overall fit.

EliseAI is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants regardless of background, in line with applicable laws.

 

💡  What it'll take to land an interview...

100% of Must-Have need to be met: 

Experience: 4+ years in UX Research or mixed UX Research / Design roles

Hands-on:

Experience with qualitative methods (interviews, usability testing, diary studies)

Experience with quantitative methods (surveys, behavioral analysis, metrics interpretation)

Strong synthesis skills with the ability to turn complex inputs into clear insights

Experience researching web, mobile web, and native applications

Experience working within fast-moving product teams and iterative development cycles

Preferred Background: Startups and small, high-ownership teams

👀 About the Company

Stan is the all-in-one platform for Creators to sell digital products, online courses, coaching sessions, memberships, and event bookings from a single link in bio. By replacing multiple tools with one simple platform, Stan makes it easy to run your business, grow your audience, and get paid instantly.

title: Chief Vibe Officer at Confidential AI Unicorn

jobsdetail.description:
About the Role

This isn't your typical "culture" role—they need someone who can literally feel when the vibe is off and course-correct before it impacts velocity.

What You'll Do:

Conduct daily "vibe checks" across all departments and flag anomalies to leadership

Design and implement vibrational strategies that align with our mission to build AGI responsibly

Own the energy of all-hands meetings, offsites, and high-stakes investor presentations

Develop KPIs around team morale, creative flow states, and psychological safety

Serve as the organizational barometer—if something feels weird, you'll know first

Curate Spotify playlists that enhance focus during deep work sprints

Mediate "vibe conflicts" before they escalate to actual HR issues

Partner with our Chief People Officer to ensure hiring decisions pass the vibe test

title: Engineering Manager, AI Tasks at Zapier

jobsdetail.description:
About the Role

As the Engineering Manager for AI Tasks, you’ll lead the team responsible for removing the biggest barriers to AI adoption: discovery, blank-canvas prompting, trust, and complexity.

🔑 Key responsibilities

Lead and develop a team of 4-6 engineers, providing technical direction, mentorship, and career growth opportunities.

Work with the engineering team to make, evaluate, and advocate for architectural decisions that align with Zapier's vision and technical standards.

Collaborate across engineering teams to evaluate and inform their technical decisions, creating alignment and removing blockers for the execution of Agents roadmap.

Collaborate closely with Product and Design to understand user needs—particularly around discovery, trust, and complexity—and translate those insights into intuitive, effective AI features.

Champion problem-solving by identifying technical challenges and improving engineering processes.

Partner with key stakeholders to tackle user problems effectively.

Communicate effectively to lead your team and keep leadership informed on your team’s progress through one-on-ones, team meetings, and leadership updates.

Foster a culture of experimentation, rapid learning, and continuous improvement
jobsdetail.requirement:
100% of Must-Haves need to be met:

You've shipped LLM-powered products and iterated over multiple releases. You have hands-on experience building and shipping LLM features, with bonus points for features that help non-experts succeed with AI such as human in the loop or guided prompting.

You’re willing to get your hands dirty. You thrive in ambiguous, fast-moving environments where rapid iteration is key. You’re comfortable prototyping user-facing AI flows, running experiments, and learning from real user behavior. You're comfortable with ambiguity and enjoy the process of turning vision into reality.

You are a skilled engineering leader. You have a proven track record of building high-quality, production-level code. If you’re not already fluent in our tech stack (Python, Django, Node, Typescript, React, AWS), you’re comfortable learning new technologies.

You have excellent communication skills. You regularly work with engineers and other stakeholders from various disciplines, balancing engineering concerns, such as technical debt, with product concerns. Ideally, you find solutions that address both the team and user needs, but if not, help build understanding around difficult decisions.

You stay technically engaged. You regularly pair with engineers to support technical decision-making despite not being an IC.

You balance architecture with pragmatism. You make informed technical decisions, knowing when to plan meticulously and when to move quickly.

You prioritize outcomes over process. You implement lightweight processes that drive results without creating unnecessary red tape.

You champion frequent deployments. You believe in shipping code regularly and improving through real-world feedback rather than seeking perfection.

You solve problems creatively. You tackle challenges with a can-do attitude, recognizing when to build new features versus strengthening foundations.

You put users first. Your decisions and leadership are guided by user needs and improving their experience.

You build relationships across teams. You collaborate effectively beyond your team and influence technical decisions for the company's benefit.

You help teams scale. You have an eye for talent that complements and expands your team’s existing capabilities.

 

Tech Stack:

Large Language Models (LLMs)

Human-in-the-loop AI

Guided prompting systems

TypeScript

React

Node.js

Python

Django

AI agents / agentic workflows
jobsdetail.benefits:
About the Company

At Zapier, they’re not just making software—they’re building a platform to help millions of businesses globally scale with automation and AI. Their mission is to make automation work for everyone by delivering products that delight their customers. You’ll collaborate with brilliant people, use the latest tools, and leverage the flexibility of remote work. Your work will directly fuel their customers’ success, and as they grow, so will you.

jobsdetail.description:
Description

Who We Are

We are Baton Corporation, a team of elite builders, moving fast and redefining what's possible. We're a high-growth software development company and proud contributors to pump.fun, the largest crypto social network globally. We build for the future.

Associate General Counsel

Reporting Structure

Reporting to the General Counsel, the Associate General Counsel will support the company’s corporate, intellectual property, employment, immigration, and litigation functions. Responsibilities include reviewing and drafting contracts, assisting with the preparation of agency filings, conducting due diligence investigations, supervising outside counsel, and providing internal legal guidance on strategic decision-making.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

Draft and review intercompany agreements, vendor contracts, employment agreements, token grants, and settlement agreements.

Track and manage internal forms for various business and legal purposes.

Draft internal memoranda for record-keeping purposes.

Organize due diligence materials for banks, regulators, and service providers.

Manage and coordinate with outside counsel.

Coordinate with litigation counsel on deadline management and matter tracking.

Assist with corporate, M&A, regulatory, litigation, and intellectual property matters as needed.

Perform other duties consistent with the position, as reasonably required.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Qualifications

Juris Doctor (JD) from an ABA-accredited law school, or an equivalent degree from a United Kingdom or EU law school.

3–5 years of experience as an associate at a major law firm or within an in-house legal department.

Excellent time, task, and project management skills, with the ability to perform complex tasks efficiently and independently.

Strong attention to detail and exceptional organisational skills.

Excellent professional writing and verbal communication skills.

Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and internal stakeholders.

Willingness and ability to learn new skills and adapt to new processes and technologies.

Corporate legal experience preferred, including familiarity with basic corporate law concepts, documents, and procedures.

Proficiency in internet-based legal research and common business applications, including Microsoft Office, Outlook, and Excel, as well as task management tools such as Notion and Slack (or equivalent systems).

Ability to maintain strict confidentiality of company and client information.
